JOSEF EBERHARDT | DIRECTOR OF HOTEL OPERATIONS MARRIOTT HOTELS | TRAVEL BRILLIANTLY Newport Beach Marriott Bayview | 500 Bayview Circle Newport Beach, CA 92660 D 949.509.6044 | F 949.854.3937 | C 702.348.7691 | marriott.com / NPBST josef.eberhardt@Marriott.com

Summary: The rooms were clean and the location is excellent but the service and website pictures don't reflect the reality "average motel accommodation"   I was surprised that Marriott puts their name in this two stars building, old and unprofessional staff
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize that you did not enjoy your experience at our property; we pride ourselves on great service and the upkeep of our beautiful property.  Please let me know if I can assist you with your travels is the future.  Again, we apologize for your experience and hope you can give us another chance to serve you.   Regards,  JOSEF EBERHARDT | DIRECTOR OF HOTEL OPERATIONS MARRIOTT HOTELS | TRAVEL BRILLIANTLY Newport Beach Marriott Bayview | 500 Bayview Circle Newport Beach, CA 92660 D 949.509.6044 | F 949.854.3937 | C 702.348.7691 | marriott.com / NPBST josef.eberhardt@Marriott.com

Summary: My husband and I just stayed here for a little get away for our 13th wedding anniversary! Wow! What an amazing experience we had! Mica, the front desk representative, was so kind from the moment we checked in until the very last day of our stay! She made our stay here extra special and we are so appreciative to her for that! The breakfast buffet was wonderful! They had everything from French toast to build your own omelettes to fresh fruit and everything in between! Waffles, pancakes and french toast are not just sitting there, they make them fresh when you place your order, which you don't see often in breakfast buffets. Javier, the chef, was awesome! So friendly and accommodating and just made you feel welcome! The room was wonderful and so spacious! I can't wait to come back
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our beautiful property! We have tried our best to build a team that love to work here and go above and beyond every day.  I will personally recognize the two associates that made your stay special!  We hope you come visit again soon!  JOSEF EBERHARDT | DIRECTOR OF HOTEL OPERATIONS MARRIOTT HOTELS | TRAVEL BRILLIANTLY Newport Beach Marriott Bayview | 500 Bayview Circle Newport Beach, CA 92660 D 949.509.6044 | F 949.854.3937 | C 702.348.7691 | marriott.com / NPBST josef.eberhardt@Marriott.com

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a convenient area
Summary: Stayed at the Newport last night. I have to say the staff are some of the friendliest I've encountered at any marriotts in America. They were very welcoming.  Big shout out to the young waiter who served us our meal last night he was so great! Food was excellent too. Rooms good size with a sitting area and very clean. Only one down side it smelled of smoke and there were quite a few cigarettes on our balcony which could have been dropped from The rooms above and a lot of stains. The hotel rooms have a no smoking policy but going by the amount of cigarettes on the gravel outside our balcony I don't think they take much notice. Reception area has a nice modern bar/sitting area with outdoor fire pit. All in all a good stay
Manager Response: Thank you for the review of our beautiful property! Our team takes pride in making our guests feel special and we always want to make sure that the room and property are clean and issue free.  We hope you come visit again soon! Summary Heading: The best thing was the breakfast Chef!
Summary: So their are many things to talk about this hotel, first their was no one that will help with your baggage, its serve yourself. Second the parking space is charged by day. In the room, it was big, but the had no robes or hotel slippers, that simple things.  That was the bad side.  But other than that, the breakfast was amazing done the by the cook Javier, so friendly and his cook is amazing. He does this " Mexican eggs" also " chicken  quesadillas ". Maybe for him, that will be a reason for me to book again in the hotel.

Summary: We recently spent 4 days,3 nights in this inviting hotel located Bayside across from Balboa Island in Newport Beach.  Each room has a nice sitting room with a sofa bed, chair & Ottoman, desk, a mini-refrigerator with a dry bar, a comfortable king size bed, and strange bathroom with sliding doors to allow occupants from both areas to use the toilet and shower, bath, and sink without bothering the others.  The rooms are nicely furnished but then you see some flaws that makes these rooms very discomforting.  Single small sink across from the closet makes the area very tight and if the sliding door is closed, you feel like you are in a tight closet. The room would be better served removing the  bath tub and increase to two sinks and room enough to eliminate bumping into one another.
Manager Response: Thank you for your taking the time to review your stay at our property. I want apologize for the unpleasant experience you described as we pride ourselves on the quality of service and products here at the Marriott Newport Beach Bayview.  Please be assured that your experience won’t go unnoticed. I have personally shared your comments with the Supervisors for attention to the items you described. Something as simple as great food and comfortable beds should be what you expect in our beautiful hotel. Summary: The hotel is your typical Marriott. A few years old with a somewhat newer lobby and common areas. The rooms are a little out of date. All rooms are suites. I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 2 months.   Pros - There is a nice walking. running trail across the street from the hotel looking at the lagoon. The rooms are large and you have plenty of room if you are spending time in the room. If you have high enough status with the brand you get a free "buffet" breakfast. If not see below. In all three of my stays the staff has at all times been very good in each interaction I have had with them.   Cons- It seems to me to be in the middle of an office park without much nearby. You will need a car or uber to get anywhere. My main fault with the hotel are two things. The

Summary: Enjoyed a 2 day stay.....traveling with my spouse and our teen daughter......room was large enough, as we had a murphy bed in the living area along with a couch......staff was very accommodating, and the location was midway to the beach and the expressway......Angela and Enzo
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for the review of the property. We hope that you think of us in the future when traveling to Newport Beach. Summary: I stayed one night here last weekend with my grown kids and we found the hotel to be clean and modern. Our room was nicely sized for three adults (son slept on couch cuz sofa bed seemed uncomfortable) and was equipped with enough towels for all of us.  This property is somewhat of a cross between a business hotel and a family place -- it's not a resort but has a small but well appointed pool area and gazebo.  However -- and here it comes -- our room was next to some kind of mechanical sound that persisted all night. It was rumbling and knocking and we couldn't figure it out. I called the front desk around midnight and he said it was guests returning to their rooms after someone set off the fire alarm and it would be quiet shortly. It wasn't. That's why I always bring earplugs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and taking the time to review your stay at our property. I want to take this opportunity to apologize for the unpleasant experience you had when visiting the Marriott Newport Beach Bayview. When trying to escape and relax noise and fire alarms are very disturbing.  Please let me know if you return to our property and I will make sure you have a pleasant experience.  Regards,  JOSEF EBERHARDT | DIRECTOR OF HOTEL OPERATIONS MARRIOTT HOTELS | TRAVEL BRILLIANTLY Newport Beach Marriott Bayview | 500 Bayview Circle Newport Beach, CA 92660 D 949.509.6044 | F 949.854.3937 | C 702.348.7691 | marriott.com / NPBST josef.eberhardt@Marriott.com

Summary: This was our first time visiting the Newport Beach area.  This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of the beach, but still close to the action.  The large suites are a huge bonus for a traveling family.  We booked a Bayview room and I think Bayview is a bit of a stretch.  The first room we were in had a view of  the side of the building, a little of the bay and mostly of the highway just off to the side and also had a very odd smell.  The front desk was great and accomodated our request to change rooms for a better view.  I'm not sure I would spend the extra on the Bayview room next time as the balconies do not have a place to sit and the views are just OK.  The highlight of our visit was the staff, especially at breakfast.  They were attentive, efficient and very friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review of our property! We are so proud to have such a beautiful property in Newport Beach and a great team to support the property.  I am glad we were able to move your room and get you a better view and hope the hustle of the holiday weekend didn't take away from your experience.   We pride ourselves in offering a great experience to our guests.   Thank you again,  JOSEF EBERHARDT | DIRECTOR OF HOTEL OPERATIONS MARRIOTT HOTELS | TRAVEL BRILLIANTLY Newport Beach Marriott Bayview | 500 Bayview Circle Newport Beach, CA 92660 D 949.509.6044 | F 949.854.3937 | C 702.348.7691 | marriott.com / NPBST josef.eberhardt@Marriott.com

Summary: When my husband and I come to Newport Beach, we always try to stay at this hotel.  The location is convenient to John Wayne Airport, the 405 and 73 Freeways, Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza for shopping and restaurants, and, f course, the beach.  Additionally, the rooms are suites, which makes us feel like we are in an apartment with a living room for relaxing or entertaining and being able to close off the bedroom for privacy when my husband wakes up super early and wants to check emails and turn on the television.  The bay view suites offer a serene view of the Back Bay just across the street, where you can also take a nice walk/jog/run along the walking/biking path.  The hotel grounds are lovely, with a lawn area and a gazebo overlooking the bay, where many weddings take
Manager Response: Thank you for such a great review of our property and associates, we hope you can come visit again soon. Summary: We've stayed at this hotel before and I always have mixed feelings about it. The location is great and we love to walk / run around the bay. Everyone is really friendly but the hotel seems to lack coordination. Every time we stay here we have issues with our bill and they take an extended period to get everything corrected. This stay was no exception.

Summary: My husband and I celebrated my 70th birthday at the Newport Beach Marriott.  We were treated like royalty.  Even Tang from the front desk went out of his way to make my celebration special.  He treated us to a bottle of wine,  cheese and crackers and chocolate dipped strawberries. The resort itself is wonderful.  Especially appreciated the suite aspect of the facility. Breakfast buffet is outstanding.  Can't wait to go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, I am so happy you thought of our property to celebrate this special day!   We look forward to having you back for your next special day! Summary: Wonderfully gracious staff. Stayed 5 days and am a very frequent Marriott guest. Daniela, Danny, Santos, Javier and their colleagues all make you feel comfortable.  Good food and very clean! The rims are spacious though the doors a bit clunky.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our team!  We are so proud to have an amazing group of associates that make this property a gem in Newport Beach. Summary Heading: Great place to stay....food was total disappointment
Summary: We had a busy day and 2 toddlers and didnt feel like going out and dealing with the crowd on a Friday night. We have stayed at many Marriotts across the country and the restaurants have been above average so we expected the same, especially in this location. We were one of the 1st ones there so they were not very busy. The service was not very good and all of our burgers were burnt. My husband and I were too hungry and just ate them but our kids would not eat theirs and we showed and told the bartender (our some what waitress) about it and she credited it. The best thing we got was our hummus plate, which was suppose to be an app but came after our burgers. Just not what we had hoped for or expected for a Marriott. The room was great and beautiful just the food situation made it
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and taking the time to reach out about your stay at our property. Summary: Service was great throughout my stay, from the front desk to the bar to room service. He layout of the lobby is a little odd as mentioned, but you can quickly walk outside where there is additional seating.   Room was clean, and I had a one bedroom suite with very large bathroom.   The views of the bay are nice, and I highly recommend running (or walking) the trails right outside. There are paved and dirt trails which go around the bay which is really nice, but look out for the horse poop!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we take pride in our great service and beautiful bay views.  We hope you come back and visit Newport Beach soon... Summary: This hotel could use some tips on attention to details. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. However, I reserved a room for four people and when we got to the room there was no bedding for the sofa bed. There was not enough towels. Only two towels. There was one mini bottle of shampoo. There was only one regular coffee packet. This may not sound like anything to complain about but when I am paying for a room and the amenities I expect it to be ready for the number of people it is booked for. I don't want to have to keep bothering the hotel staff for thing that should have been in the room to begin with. With that said the location of the hotel was convenient to shopping and many activities. Also a huge winning point for me was the fact that this hotel is adjacent to

Thank again for the review and have a Brilliant day!  Warmest regards,  Sean

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here and enjoyed the view of the bay. Nice lounging area outside of the restaurant/bar. That being said, the dining area is the first thing you see when you walk in the entrance of the hotel (very open) and the bar is connected to the dining area. Not really a separate entity. Anyhow, I found the layout a little odd.  The rooms are just okay. They are really in need of updating and some refurbishment. Room was clean though with housekeeping service a little on the slow side.  Good customer service. Enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for submitting this review for our hotel. I will review your information with the Departments that are directly involved to discuss ways to improve the look of our guest rooms. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and please come to stay with us again whenever you are in the Newport Beach area.  Warmest regards,  Sean M.

Summary: The staff here provided excellent service! Everyone we encountered was helpful and so pleasant! We were only there for a quick overnight stay but would definitely go back again. It's a smaller property so no valet or concierge but rooms are big and comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast - food was delicious and service was great!

Summary: Large rooms with separate sitting area with couch and desk. Nice view if you get bayside room.  Nice bar in the lobby with outdoor fire pits.  Close to shopping, beach and freeways.  They have a small snack bar in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Quiet hotel overlooking natural sanctuary and running trails
Summary: Same management runs Costa Mesa Marriott.  This hotel's rooms are nicer - each a suite.  Some wear and tear, but overall fantastic experience every time i've stayed there.  Marriott elite members get breakfast in restaurant - which is excellent - as there is not a concierge lounge.  There is always a fresh breeze where it sits atop a small hill surrounded by large trees.  Very quiet!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the 5 star review of our little gem here in Newport Beach!  We hope you are able to visit us again soon... Summary: There are several Marriotts in this area and this one is the best location with the best staff.  Great upper Newport Bay views, professional staff with a quality restaurant.  A bit noisy from nearby Jamboree Road but that is the only negative.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our beautiful property.  We really take pride in the property and the service we provide to our guests. Summary Heading: An experience to remember in just 1 night!
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night with my 2 young daughters for a "Mommy and Daughter" getaway. Upon arriving to the hotel, we were greeted by friendly faces and a beautiful hotel. The hotels interior was modern and fresh. With large windows facing the bay, the Southern California sun illuminated the lobby and restaurant. When we checked in, the Front Desk agent was so hospitable! She chatted with my young daughters and was so friendly. We went to our beautiful suite overlooking the Bay and it was breath taking. Although I am a SoCal resident, the hotel took me away from the everyday monotony of OC living. From our window, we saw horseback riders, hikers, and beautiful cranes that would fly around and land in the bay. It was an amazing site especially with a beautiful sunset as
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the Marriott Bayview it was great to see you when you visited our property.   We will be waiting to treat you to another amazing stay when you can visit us again... Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but Glitches Affected Our Stay
Summary: One night stay in a suite on the top floor.   Room is nice and spacious. There is a TV in the LR and a TV in the bedroom. When we got back from our event, the bedroom TV didn't work. No way of making it work either as maintenance was already gone for the night. That sucks.  Air conditioning: I'm guessing this is one of the units which senses your presence. Temp was fine until the sun started coming up on our east facing room. AC failed to come on until I walked out to the LR to check the thermostat. I can understand using a presence sensor, but they should be disabled at night. Who's going to get up every few hours to 'make your presence known' to the air conditioner?  Pool and spa both appear nice.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We really appreciate your review of our property. I have shared your feedback with the Departments that are directly involved and apologize regarding the issues that occurred during your stay. We hope that you can give us another chance to serve you in the near future.   Warmest regards,  Sean

Summary: Over the years I've logged several hundred nights at this hotel.  The staff is friendly and service oriented,  Kavin with room service is exceptional. Javier and the entire breakfast crew are particular standouts.  Other areas fall short.  The dinner and room service menu is extremely limited and never changes.  If you're looking for a great meal after a long day you wont find it here.  Room and facility maintenance is also an issue.  Several rooms I've stayed in have ripped drapes and dirty carpets.  During a stay last December all rooms above the 5th floor did not have hot water.  Also the fitness room equipment is in need of service and the AC does not function properly.  I've expressed these concerns to management on multiple occasions however nothing gets done.   I post
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to write a review about our property. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we do have some plans in near future regarding the update of our hotel. Thank you again for your business and we hope to serve again in the near future.  Warmest Regards,  Sean

Summary: I love the fact that they took care of me so well even before checking in they were so nice and they told me to about a great little local restaurant turned out to be amazing. i personally work for a Marriott and they way they did things was above and beyond Marriott standard. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Thank you for the amazing stay and I will surely be back
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for the great review!  The team here is always happy to assist with anything that makes your stay better when visiting Newport Beach! Summary: Clean, well located and welcoming helpful staff.   We arrived late during a front-desk shift change.  One of the receptionists was on her way out (bag on shoulder, coat on, keys in hand.)  She saw that her replacement was busy on a phone call, dropped everything and returned to the desk to check us in with a smile.  It was very gracious and the remainder of our stay reflected the same level of service.  We booked a King Suite, Room 912, and it was very spacious and comfortable.  Had a view of the parking lot, but the mountains behind and the cityscape were actually very pretty.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property and staff service.  We really feel like we have a hidden gem in this busy area where you can escape and enjoy paradise!   Our team takes pride in amazing service and we are always looking for ways to make sure our guests are taken care of from start to finish. Summary: Had a wonderful stay at the Marriott, but the customer service we received from "EVEN" was top notch!!! 👍👍👍👍He was not only friendly but went over and beyond my expectations of a front desk clerk. He got us ice, carried our bags and brought us extra cups to our room. It was clear he didn't do it for a tip, because he even carried our bags when we left.

Summary Heading: Love the room size, but the A/C just blows and blows
Summary: The room size if very nice. Living area and bedroom. The location is great. 3 miles from Fashion Island. My complaint is that the air conditioning blows directly on the bed. It could have not been more direct. Also, it's time for an update on the rooms. I would stay here again for the pros, but not expect a great night sleep. Expensive parking also.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We greatly appreciate the feedback from your stay and will ensure that all the Departments are informed that are directly involved. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to serve you in the near future.  Warmest regards,  Sean

Summary: My family and I stayed here for one night. Check in was a smooth as can be. The lady at the front desk helped me and quickly checked me in. Transporting the bags was pretty easy as I left my car in front for a moment and then took our belonging to our room. The hotel is very clean on the inside. When you walk into the hotel every thing looks in order and no trash was on the floor. When I was in our room I asked for extra pillows and sheets and an employee came up right away to our room. The workers at this hotel do not seem to overstressed and were all very helpful. My kids swam at the pool and we got some drinks at the indoor bar. The bar tender was very nice. We also brought our bikes and in the afternoon we biked along the back bay and in the morning of our check out we went

Great hotel and probably the most friendly staff I've ever encountered at a Marriott property (I'm Platinum so I've stayed a lot). The mini suites are very comfortable with nice mattresses. Fire pits outside are great and relaxing. If you eat the breakfast buffet and Javiero is cooking, ask for his special omelet. Avocado and verde sauce over a stuffed everything omelet. Perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your terrific review of our property. We greatly appreciate your loyalty and love to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Also, I will make sure Javier is commended for his special omelet skills. We hope to serve you again in the near future. Have a wonderful weekend.  Warmest regards,  Sean

Summary: Arrived Marriott Newport, Bayview, after long flight from Bangkok....excellent check in...quiet, spacious , comfortable, modern room, with a view to Newport Beach, back bay...everything exceeded expectations ...super staff, nice environment, good location, away from heavy population, but close enough for a quick drive, to everything Newport Beach is known for...highly recommend...
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your excellent review of our property. We strive to make everyone to feel at home and glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations. We look forward to serve you again in the near future.   Warmest regards,  Sean

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights at $230 per night (without parking ($20) and WiFi ($12)). It's a typical business traveller hotel but we as a family with a kid felt extremely welcomed and can definitely recommend this hotel!  + Service + Clean + Good value - If you are close to the lift it may be a bit noisy (same as with plans occationally starting at the near airport) - You need to drive to get to Newport town or to the beach

It used to be a MARRIOTT SUITES, so all the rooms are indeed suites.  A pleasant living room with a wet bar and fridge, a bedroom with its own TV and a very spacious bathroom, complete with tub and stall shower.  The breakfast buffet was BAD, weak coffee, not much variety, but the servers were pleasant.  Free WIFI for Marriott Rewards members but warning:  parking is a whopping TWENTY-FIVE BUCKS each day.  Yuck.

Great location for business meetings. Staff is helpful, the meals were custom for large & small group meetings and we were happily surprised by the great staff. Intimate atmosphere and lovely rooms.  Beautiful view of the back bay We will do our meetings here and continue going forward

Be sure to request a room with a view of the harbor/bay. Very close to beautiful Balboa Island and plenty of trials to walk, hike, and bike.   Rooms are spacious and nice sized bathrooms too. Fold out beds make it easier for families, especially since one can close the doors between the two rooms for some privacy.

This was our second visit to the Marriott, and we were pleasantly surprised by the remodeled lobby and dining area. This upgrade was needed and it really made a difference in our stay as the food was much better. The rooms were great as always, and the staff very friendly and helpful. This is a great location and a real value in the area for family travel.

Enjoyed our stay very much Staff friendly  Room large with separate lounge area which you could close the doors to bedroom  Two large TVs  Very clean bathroom. Balcony nice little small and no chairs and Bayview is ok but traffic is a little loud but once the door is closed ok. Jacuzzi partly inside and quite large The pool was also heated good lounge chairs and fire pits. Had Room service once best Cesar salad I have eaten and arrived in 10 mins.  Would stay here again and would recommend

Summary Heading: Javier is best thing at this hotel
Summary: This is an all suite location with no microwaves in the rooms. There is a shared microwave near the ice machine on each floor. Newer rooms with view of back bay which is not worth the visit. No shuttle service and no food stores close so you need a car for eating options.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your experience at our property. I will ensure that Javier is recognized for his outstanding service. We appreciate your feedback and will share with the appropriate departments. We look forward to serving again in the near future.  Warmest regards,  Sean McNamara

Summary Heading: $26 for a glass of wine, $286 for a quick bite, not dinner.  About $600 for one-night stay with loud dog barking next
Summary: Although the hotel is OK, the restaurant is very expensive.  We were not very hunger and only order appetizers and wine.  The bill came to $286 - the wine is $26 a glass.  There is no wine menu, hence we were not informed of the price for a glass of "house wine".  Needlessly to say, the one-night stay comes to almost $600.  About 11:00 pm, the dog next to our room returns with his/her owner and started barking.  Very loud.  I had to call the front desk to change to a different room. Then again, on a second thought, I asked if they could move them, along with the dog.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I sincerely apologize regarding your experience at our property. I will speak to the restaurant staff to ensure that they are clear on the pricing to our guests. We are a pet friendly hotel, however we do our best not to interupt other guests who do not have a pet with them. Again, we apologize for your experience and hope you can give us another chance to serve you. I wish you well on your future travels.  Warmest Regards,  Sean McNamara

Summary: Choose hotel because they had a special where they waived the dog fee.  Once we checked in could think of ten others reasons why we would choose it.  Very friendly staff, great rooms, if you travel with your dog great place to stay.  Even if you don't no complaints.

Summary Heading: Great views of the Bay-Near Bayview Trail.
Summary: My husband & I spent New Years/ Anniversary here. The interior of the hotel is very nice/upscale. Great dining area that overlooks the Bay. Also has a big outdoor area with fire pits. The food was very good. Pleasant surprise. Have the Cheese Tasting, it's yummy! They also have a Starbucks station ( limited drink choices though) in the bar area. But there is a real Starbucks 5 minutes (Driving time) from the hotel. And the Malls are less than 10 minutes. Loved being just across the street from the Bayview Nature path. They have a gym that my husband uses as he stays here for business travel also, but I prefer excising outdoors. Absolutely beautiful for a morning/afternoon or evening run or walk. The room was nice with a desk for working, couch and chair. We had a room on the

Summary Heading: A Platinum Member and very pleased with our stay!
Summary: My wife and I travel extensively and could not have been more pleased with our stay.  The location is just close enough to the beach, but just far away enough from the tourist chaos, great hotel at a resonable price. The staff at Bayview are particularly friendly and professional, at the top of Marriott standards. Thanks Nor for the great suite, quiet and spacious with a very nice view of the bay. Thanks to Nathan and Danny and also Silver for their particularly attentive and thoughtful breakfast service. Also Clement for the afternoon wine service outside by the fire-pit and Javier for perfect omlettes for breakfast each day. It was New Years Eve, but our suite was completely quiet, comfortable and very clean. Only improvement I'd suggest would be to install current LED TVs. We
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Great to hear you had a wonderful stay with us! I will make sure that Nour, Nathan, Danny, Silver, Clement and Javier all get recognized for their outstanding service. We look forward to seeing you again very soon! Have a great day.  Sean McNamara

Summary Heading: Suite breakfast and staycation!  5 star service.
Summary: The breakfast is terrific especially for a hotel in this price range.  The head chef is terrific (Javier?), makes the eggs benedict to order and it turns out perfect everytime.  I also like that every room is a suite, we've had the parlor suite twice and it makes for a more comfortable stay.  The decor needs updating but overall the registration employees and restaurant waiters and bartenders give you 5 star service.  We stay in Newport often and rotate between this Marriott and Fashion Island Marriott and the Hyatt depending on where we want to be.  Even though this location (closer to South Coast Plaza and JW Airport) does not have the decor of the others, its service makes up for it.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for the amazing review on our property. We pride ourselves on our service and I will make sue the team is recognized for their efforts. We look forward to serve you again in the near furture. Have a wonderful week.  Sean McNamara

Summary: Excellent service from the front desk staff as well as the staff in the restaurant. Breakfast area was kept clean, food was good. Ate a late dinner two times and was not disappointed.  Hotel room was clean and comfortable. Only complaint is that in hotel room they ask you to conserve water however it did take quite some time to get hot water in the shower.

The hotel has nothing special. Average.  It's old. I didn't hear any noise from next door room. That is good.  Reception desk people were not a great help. We had a reservation problem with travel agency when checked in. We had to wait 30minutes till everything goes through.
Manager Response: Thank  you for taking the time to send your feedback. I apologize for your lengthy check in experiece. We aim to make the check in process as efficient as possible and have contacted the departments neccessary to allow the 3rd party reservations to check in more smoothly.  Thank You again for your thoughts.

Summary: On a recent trip to Orange Country to take a cruise to view the Newport Christmas lights, my husband and I stayed in the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  We were not disappointed.  As is typical with most Marriott properties, the facilities were spotless, the rooms were well-appointed and the customer service was outstanding.  This hotel is conveniently located to many local attractions and has an excellent restaurant on the property.  We will definitely return.

Hotel is really nice. I stayed in a king room. Big room with separate tub and shower. Office space. 2tvs and nice area. Free wifi with Marriott rewards only else 12.00/day.  Parking available for $25/day. You have no option if yu are driving. No free breakfast but they have a restaurant which is lil expensive. Nice swimming pool.  My bad experience: I had a room next to elevator which started making noise since 5:00 in the morning that woke me up. Just FYI try to stay away from elevator room.

I had occasion to be in Newport last Friday and enjoyed a night at the Marriott Bayview.  The room was a nice-sized suite with a great bathroom and really comfy bed!  The check-in process was smooth and the rate was attractive for this area.  I would definitely stay there again.  And, with incredible weather like they had, I just might!

Exactly what you would expect from a Marriott.  They do sit on a lagoon and have a nice walking path around it.  The back of the property has a nice outdoor sitting area.  The rooms are nice. If you like Marriott - I am platinum - you will like this property.  Solid, not exceptional.

The check-in was very smooth. The desk personnel were delightful. The room was clean nicely appointed. The only real complaint we had was that for three people, there was only enough coffee for one cup. That was rectified the next day as we left a note for Maura with housekeeping. For me, the only complaint I would have is the fee for parking. When there is no viable transportation as there is in D.C. or NYC, I feel that the fees are just greedy.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It's wonderful to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay at our property. I will follow up with our Housekeeping Team to ensure we are placing the correct amount of amenities in each guest room. Again, thank you for staying with us and we look forward to serve you in the near future.   Warmest regards,  Sean M.

Summary: My husband and I stayed in an executive suite with our daughter while he was in Newport Beach on business. The room was quite spacious, clean, lovely views of the back bay. Food for breakfast and dinner was quite pricy but it's sort of what you expect in terms of hotel prices. Though we did notice the quality of food was nicer on some days than on others which we found a bit odd. Overall I thought the experience was pleasant and the staff were very accommodating with my two year-old.

The hotel is 10 minutes from Santa Ana airport and conveniently located in Newport Beach. I believe it is an all-suite hotel, with comfortable and clean rooms. The only thing that was missing in my room was a wardrobe, but there was enough space to put my stuff. Breakfast buffet is varied and good, there is a cook whom you can ask your favourite eggs dish.

Summary Heading: My Favorite Hotel in Newport/Huntington Beach
Summary: This hotel is always my first choice when I visit the Newport/HB area.  The lobby was recently remodeled and it looks very classy.  The staff is incredibly friendly, and professional.  Check-in runs smoothly and you're always made to feel welcomed.  The rooms are very clean and spacious, complete with a coffee maker and mini refrigerator.  There are doors to separate the sitting area from the sleeping room, in case you want a better feeling of "privacy".  The hotel is in a great location, with easy access to shopping in Newport  Beach, as well as a straight shot west to the CA 1 (PCH).  Surrounding neighborhood is very clean, safe, and upscale, so if you wish to go for a morning run, you can do so confidently.  There is also easy access to lots of restaurants in the area, and

Summary Heading: Clean place to lay your head
Summary: My husband and I like to get away to Newport Beach when ever we can. My husband likes to run around the bay the hotel overlooks, so we decided to try this hotel. This Marriott is more of a corporate hotel, quiet, in a business plaza and not resort like. The rooms are clean and laid out nicely. The bed are not very comfortable. Planes from the nearby airport fly directly over the hotel.  My biggest issue was that there is a pantry rather then a gift shop, two small bottled waters cost us $6.50. Rather excessive.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your great comments regarding your stay at our property. The Back Bay Trail in front of the hotel is a great place to take a run! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to serve you in the future.  Warm regards,  Sean

Summary: The Newport Beach Marriott Bayview is centrally located, and close to downtown Newport Beach with its restaurants and nightlife. The Bayview is an upscale Marriott property, with a decent (if pricy) breakfast buffet.

I was slightly skeptical of this hotel from the outset -- it's not often you can snag a 3.5-star hotel in Newport Beach for the $100-150 range per night on a weekend. I was spending a leisure weekend in Newport Beach, and wanted a place relatively close to both shopping and the beach. This property meets both of those quite well. I found the drive to my favorite beach (Crystal Cove) to be roughly about 10-15 minutes, depending on time of day, and the hotel is surrounded by excellent places to shop.  The room itself was quite massive, considering the typical size in this location. I had a standard suite, and the room seemed to be quite clean and well cared for. It wasn't the most technologically-updated room I've ever experienced (the TVs -- yes, there are two of them -- seemed a

Registration desk was very helpful & friendly. They accommadated us a very good room/suit on the top floor. Nice experience overall. Nice surroundings in the pool area with casibos close by. Parking had no fee.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your wonderful review of our property. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience. We look forward to serve you in the future! Enjoy the rest of your weekend.  Sean M.

Summary: The lack of shelf space in the huge bathroom is a deal breaker for me and I would not stay here again. The bathroom layout is extremely inefficient. The sink is one small space with only a few inches of vanity on either side. The tub, toilet, and shower are in a separate space separated by a pocket door, and there is NO shelving in that area. A huge empty space is wasted. I stored my toiletries in the tub.  The pocket doors from the bedroom to the sink area and toilet area were hard to slide, making it difficult to have privacy.  The living room area was large, but again, the space was not well used. The credenza area where the coffee was did not add much shelf space to the room. It would have been great if there had been another sink or even more shelf space. The sofa and chair
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review for our property. We apologize regarding the layout of the room. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate departments and appreciate the constructive criticism. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your breakfast and gym experience. We thank you for staying with us and look forward to serving you in the future. Have a fantastic weekend.  Sean M

Summary Heading: Not much of view but nice hotel
Summary: Good choice as the hotel is located in walking distance to the office I visited. It's not glamorous but it is not supposed to be. I did expect a "Bayview" but then realised it's the name of the street. Very good service, good choice of food and nice room. Having been in Boston the week before, the room felt like a serious suite...  Newport Beach it self is a very fun place to go...

We had such an amazing experience here!!!! Check in was easy and all the staff was very friendly!  The night we got there the bar had a wine tasting special so we enjoyed that out on the beautiful patio over looking the bay.   All the staff was very friendly and helpful!   The room was amazing! Perfect size for our family. We loved having a separate room from the living area so we could spread out a bit.   I would recommend staying here any time!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! We look to serve you again in the near future. Have a great weekend!  Warm regards,  Sean

Summary Heading: Not terrible but every aspect needs a facelift
Summary: Location is convenient (73 and Jamboree), but the property is showing a ton of age.  Rooms are quirky in size/organization (e.g. 2 sinks in about a 5 foot space), parking is expensive and painful.  Far from high end which I was expecting out of a Newport Beach Marriott.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time for writing this review. We really appreciate the feedback and apologize for your experience at our property. We have shared this information with our team to enhance the guest experience moving forward. We take great pride in providing ultimate guest satisfaction and we wish you well on your next travels.   Warm regards,  Sean McNamara

Summary: I had just finished a week in disneyland with the family and we needed a few days to recover.   I found a great rate for this hotel and booked it 30 minutes before arriving.     I booked a king bed room and when we checked in we were upgraded to a family suite. Desk staff was very friendly and the room was very nice. Separate bedroom from the kids who sleep in the Murphy bed.    We used the pool and the bar staff was very attentive bringing us drinks and food. The pool overlooks the bay.  Great hotel to get away for a few days or if you are here on business. Only complaint would be no microwave,  no in room safe and it had the world's smallest fridge.   Parking is also $25 per day but depending on the rate you find it all evened out in the end for us.

we stayed in this hotel because its location and pet friendliness. It was a nice stay with big suite, living room and bedroom and bathroom. Things were generally clean , perhaps little bit dusty since my husband had an allergy attack. Downstairs had a open concept restaurant with nice patio area. I would have liked if there was a free coffee in the morning , some hotels do that .  The area around the hotel is fairly busy but there are walkways to walk your dog and go for a run. The area felt pretty safe and i was confortable walking my dogs at night.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay in Newport Beach
Summary: I checked in fairly late and didn't know what to expect since I haven't travelled to this area previously.  In a word, it couldn't be better.  It's an all suite hotel, a first in my experience for Marriott, and the suite is first rate with upscale amenities.  But I digress.  Check in was very smooth since I had used mobile check in and the front desk personnel were excellent.  The lobby is really nice and up to Marriott's highest standards.  Now, back to the room.  It's a two room suite and well furnished with a sofa, easy chair, desk and plenty of light.  There's also a service bar with coffee maker and a mini fridge.  The bedroom is well furnished as well with a very comfortable bed with a duvet.  The bedroom has its own flat screen TV as well.  The bath is two rooms as well
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time write this wonderful review for our property. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your entire experience while staying with us. I will share this information with my team and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Warm regards,  Sean McNamara

Summary: This hotel is a really good overnight weekend getaway. My family and I came to this hotel for a quick weekend stay. The service was fast, and the staff was nice. The room was the best part. It was massive, and it had a balcony. The TV had lots of channels, and the wifi was OK. Also, the room had a fridge, and the beds were really comfy. All in all, the room is 10/10 stars. However, the staff said that I would have a partial bay view, but I got no bay view. Also, the pool is in need of a makeover. The bottom needs a massive paint-over, however I think that a half indoor half outdoor pool is creative and exciting, so points go to the hotel there. Also, they have pool noodles and small floats already there, so it is perfectly fine for anyone wanting to play with pool noodles while
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write this wonderful review for our hotel. We are glad to hear that your overall experience was great. We look forward to serve you in the future. Enjoy the rest of your week.  - Sean McNamara

Summary: We a had a girls night away here and it was lovely! Very nice staff. Very clean and the food at the cafe was so good. We loved our balcony view of the bay. We had the family suite and it was perfect for the 6 of us! We will definitely be back 😊
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! I am glad to hear that your experience was excellent at our property. We look forward to serving you in the future.   Warm regards,  Sean McNamara

Summary: Quiet and comfortable for business travelers, very clean and friendly staff. It's a bit far from the beach and other tourist attractions, but if you're there for business it's a great option. Only one criticism - skip room service. Ordered it twice and the food was sub-par.
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for taking the time to write a wonderful review for our hotel. We take great pride in providing top notch service for our guests and we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. I will follow with our food and beverage time to ensure that our room service experience is up to Marriott standards. Thank you again for the great feedback and we hope to serve you again in the near future.   Warm regards,  Sean

Summary: I was staying here during the 2015 Labor Day with my wife, just for one night, just to get out of town for a bit. Didn't have a feeling that hotel was terribly busy, but probably still much busier than expected. Simple meals like BLT and hamburger took over an hour to prepare (?). Other than that, management was very professional, we got early check-in, room  was nice and quiet, really no complains there.  The pool is very small and really not for large family vacations. I wish Marriott would tell you that there is $25 self-parking fee before you actually complete booking on their Web-page.

We booked three nights and extended one more on our trip through California as the hotel was so nice. Definitely one of the best we had throughout our trip. Rooms are big and spacious, nicely decorated and convenient. The beds extremely comfortable. This hotel seems to be very well managed. Whomever we met from reception desk, housekeeping, restaurants - everyone very nice, friendly and helpful. The staff really makes you feel welcome. The rooms are very clean and well maintained.   The breakfast was delicious and whoever attended us was very kind - simply great service. We would definitely book again. This seems to be a perfect place, for business or leisure. As we live in Asia we might be a bit spoiled by the standard but the Marriott did even exceed our expectations.

Great size rooms for families. Love the sitting room. First time to he area so I think this is a good location as it seemed central to many beaches and restaurants. The beds were ok. The room service was terrible. Really really bad and very expensive. The staff was great at check In. Would stay here again but would not order the food.

Excellent hotel, i went there for a weekend with my family, and we shared same suite . the suite was over the bay.IT was large with separate room, clean, and neat. The bed was so comfortable,The staff at the desk were helpful.

The hotel has nice views over the bay. Service is attentive. Rooms are cozy and well kept. Cozy bed. The breakfast is very nice. They rent bikes at reasonable prices. There's a parking lot, which is very useful. The only downside: the location is not the best in the city, but if you rent a car, it shouldn't be a problem either

Summary Heading: Great weekend getaway at the beach
Summary: Had a great time.  Close to everything but far enough away too.  Our son loved the pool and enjoyed the elevators.  We would definitely stay again.   We were there for a wedding and may be back for a second honeymoon.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel with Excellent Service
Summary: This hotel is on the back part of the bay in Newport Beach.  The staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful. The lobby area is very nice!  There is a a large area to eat or have drinks and relax. Our room was a suite over looking the Bay Area.  It was very large with a  separate room and a very nice bathroom too.  The bed was very comfortable! The whole room was nicely decorated and living room very comfortable. We had a small balcony too. Outside, by the pool area was a very nice patio area with lots of seating and gas fireplaces . We had a dessert in the patio area and the service was excellent!  The only bad thing about this hotel was the 25.00 fee to park. If they had valet, I wouldn't had minded the charge at all because this is a very nice hotel with great service! I

Our family has stayed at this hotel 4 times and we love it! We went to Newport Beach for a week for a family vacation and we spent 5 of the days at the beach. It is a beautiful location on the back bay and convenient to get to the beach, Fashion Island, a grocery store, and restaurants. There is a beautiful walking/running/biking path that goes along the bay. The staff were all friendly, efficient, and helpful! The new lobby is beautiful and our room was very clean. In the lobby they offer complimentary water garnished with different fruits. The bathroom set up is perfectly for multiple people to get ready and we liked having a separate shower and tub and pocket doors to divide the bathroom area. There is plenty of drawer space and closet space. After a day at the beach it is

Staff was helpful, the room was very nice for the price.  Parking was very scarce and maybe that is why they charged $25 a night for self parking.  The location isn't handy, but it is close enough to most things in the area.  Not really near anything.

Summary Heading: Terrible from the moment we checked In
Summary: We stayed as a young family in this so called 'hotel' our daughter was still on bottle feeds at the time, there were absolutely no facilities in the hotel to boil the water for the child's bottle, leading Us to buying a new kettle in Walmart and bringing it back to the hotel, staff terrible Barr a few on reception who offered us breakfast tokens as an apology for our horrendous experience, the bar staff were uninterested and one particular night having ordered a strawberry daiquiri I was subject to abuse under the breath of the staff, just getting round to posting now as I've decided to start leaving reviews. But I would definitely avoid and have avoid the Marriott Franchise Since,

This hotel overlooks the bay at Newport Beach, not the ocean. But it is a beautiful hotel. The room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We had a room with a balcony that overlooks the bay and it was really nice. There is a patio area with fire pits, the pool looks nice (though we didn't use it), and there is a restaurant and bar. Definitely would stay here again.

This is a great hotel if you're doing business up in Newport Beach or just doing a quick overnight trip from San Diego to enjoy the OC scene the next day.  Clean, fantastic service, and very conveniently located.

The hotel is conveniently located not for from the highways and shopping areas. The views from the pond-facing rooms are very nice. The room was very large and quiet (although some aircraft from the nearby airport could be heard). Service was very good throughout the hotel. The hotel offers self-parking (very close to the hotel entrance). There is no safe in the room, which is very rare these days.

Check-in was easy, rooms were very nice, beds soft.  Really no problems.  Parking Fee of $25 per day and fairly high room rates were the only negative.  I eventually used Priceline and got a reasonable rate so overall very nice.

A beautiful setting, a short drive from the heart of Newport.  Not the most elegant CA coastal hotel like the not-too-distant Ritz Carlton, but still nice,  Would have liked to see some more amenities and a top notch gourmet bistro.  Not a disappointing stay nevertheless,

Stayed for 2 nights to celebrate my daughters 24th birthday. Upon check-in I was greeted courteously by a gentleman named Connor. I asked him if we could get an early check-in and he was very accommodating and noticed we had 4 adults in our party so he upgraded us to a King parlor suite with a murphy bed. That was a very nice gesture, thank you Connor! I must say the murphy bed was a little too firm for my daughter and her husband, but they were happy not to have to sleep in a sofa bed.  The rooms are clean and quiet. The King bed was comfortable and the comforters are plush. The balconies are not much to boast about, as you can barely walk outside, but it is nice to open the sliding door for fresh air. We didn't have a bay view, but the city lights at night were nice.  We spent

I like that it is a Marriott and I like that it's roomy, but for almost 50% less, I'll stay at the Santa Ana Hampton Inn where they don't charge extra for parking and wifi and breakfast is included. In addition, this Marriott is a bit older though it is clean. Nice view if you overlook the water but if you are working, you will hear the planes taking off and landing.

While I visit the area frequently I had never stayed at this Marriott until this past Friday night. My wife and I had tickets for a soccer match at Stub Hub Center and decided to stay down in OC rather than  fight the traffic home to LA.  We arrived late at just past 11 PM so the restaurant had just closed but the bar was open. Our room was large and very comfortable. We both slept great.  A highlight was breakfast in the hotel restaurant on Saturday morning. The service from Nathan was superb and the food was delicious. They were able to accommodate my wife's gluten allergy and were very attentive. I stay at Marriotts all over the world and have Platinum status and I have to say this was the best breakfast I've ever had at a Marriott. The hotel is right on Jamboree Road off the

Great choice in pricey Newport Beach. Lobby has been completely renovated and is very contemporary, roomy, and comfortable. Lovely outdoor seating with fire pits overlooking Newport bay. All suite rooms are newer and clean, with a bedroom and living room, which are separated by double French doors. Bathroom has separate shower, tub and sink area. Really great for accommodating different sleeping patterns. Staff also wonderful, friendly and helpful. Got great treatment as a Gold elite member, free breakfast daily and free enhanced wifi.  A couple of issues, we faced the highway and it was really noisy. I don't think the windows are double glazed, but they need to be, as we heard measurable traffic and airplane noise on the 8th floor. Also, the bathroom shower and tub were not

The hotel interior was beautiful and modern.  Our king room was a suite with a sofa bed in the adjacent living area.  The bathroom was gorgeous with a separate tub/shower.  It was decorated with high end materials and appeared polished.  The location was in a business park area, not a vacation setting.  However it was a 15 minute drive without traffic to Newport Beach restaurants. The view from our room was of rooftops, nothing great.  If that is important to you inquire about upgraded room with a better view. Overall great room with average location.  Oh, forgot to mention 25$  charge for parking seems strange for the location.  They basically gated off their own parking lot just to have the ability to charge for parking.

Summary Heading: Lovely service, good location (not beachfront), a bit of a gouge
Summary: I am a Marriott points member, and enjoy the Marriott product a lot.  This hotel is on a bluff by the Back Bay of Newport, bordering Irvine.  The setting is one part natural, two parts light industrial.  There is a lovely pool which is half covered, half outdoors, the temperature a touch too cool for my liking.  (I love to swim and soak.)  The pool area is very comfortable, and the hot tub is good and hot.  Excellent workout room.  Bar and food service overpriced and strange.  My husband and I decided to share a beer and some food, and were were brought 2 cups with 1/3 pour in each ($8 draft), and a third cup with another 1/3 pour, which the server announced contained a "complimentary sample of a new brew."  Nice idea, poor execution.  $50 dollars for 2/3 of a beer, a plate of

We were in S. Calif for a 4th of July family party and stayed at the Marriott Bayview Friday and Saturday nights. The rate we chose was for a bay view and breakfast. Both were very nice. Unfortunately the neighboring room had some young girls playing their rap music very loudly. The nice thing about this hotel is the bedroom has a door between the living room and the bedroom and with the door closed we did not hear the rap any longer.

I had never stayed at this particular Marriott hotel before and am glad that I did! The staff upon checking in was very friendly and most accommodating, particularly Melissa, whom I had the great pleasure of interacting with for the duration of my stay. Professional and easy to talk to you can tell Melissa enjoys being around her guests. She was an absolute delight! All the rooms are suites and mine was spacious, comfortable, and had a great view of the bay. Though I did not dine in the hotel, I overheard some other guests talking about how great their dinner was as they got in the elevator. I really had a great stay and will definitely return to this hotel in the future!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at A Reasonable Expense
Summary: I have stayed at this Newport property on several occasions and I am always happy to return.  I typically stay in a room with the view overlooking the Nature Preserve.  The hotel is very clean and the rooms and bed very comfortable.  The sleep area and the living space are separated by a door and as such there are two separate distinct areas.  I would highly recommend this hotel to someone who wants to be near the many sites of Newport Beach.

Only 10 minutes from the airport, but no hotel shuttle. Property is located in a business park, so quiet at night. Backbay view is fair, but not worth paying extra for. Great restaurants nearby either at the airport or towards Newport Hills/Beach. Very friendly and efficient front desk and restaurant service. Rooms were clean but could use some updated furniture. Lobby design is confusing. Gym access by walking outside, then around the pool. Breakfast buffet hidden around a corner. But, staff is great at giving directions.

We had to stay an extra couple of days beyond our reservation due to family illness. The management understood our situation was able to accommodate us so we did not have to change hotels. It's this kind of personal treatment that will have us return to this property.  The staff overall is friendly and helpful.

This is a traditional style hotel that has had some updating lately that is noticeable as soon as you walk in the entrance.  The bar and restaurant have been updated and are open until 11 pm, which is good as there is nothing within walking distance, with the exception of a Japanese restaurant. It might be good, I didn't try it. I liked the Marriot's food & they have some good micro brews and wine as well.   The rooms are all 1 bedroom suites, larger than your average hotel room. Mine had a small refrigerator which I gather they all do. Microwaves are on each floor next to the ice machines.  They also have a pool, excercise room & hot tub. You can walk to the 10 mile trail around the Newport Upper Bay Ecological Reserve that people walk, run, bike or ride horses on. There are no

Connor at the front desk checked me in and my experience was outstanding. he was absolutely amazing to be greeted by when arriving at the hotel. My room was facing the bay and had a balcony. The pool was very nice and we enjoyed swimming with just a few people because we stayed on a Tuesday night. The hotel is just minutes from Newport Beach, which is a beautiful beach! The only complaint I had was I requested shampoo and conditioner and an extra blanket but they were never delivered and I fell asleep waiting. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and will be back!

This hotel has an amazing location, minutes to John Wayne Airport, and about 15 minutes south to Laguna Beach. We have stayed here a few times and really enjoyed it. The beds are super soft and comfortable. They are also very spacious. The pool area is awesome, with a little indoor-outdoor feel to it.  My only complaint is the lack of free Wi-Fi. At this price point, and with many business customers, the place should have free Wi-Fi. I thought this was common in the year 2015.

We were staying at a hotel in Huntington Beach, over plans had changed and we needed an extra two nights accommodation. At such short notice the Marriott was one of the only hotels that were available, I must say I am more impressed with the Marriott than our previous $500 per night hotel. Travelling with three children under 5 the rooms are perfect as you can close off the main bedroom to the lounge room which also has a sofa bed. The bathroom also has a bath and shower. Rooms were spotless. Location is close to fashion island and 10 minutes to newport. Parking is $25 and $13 a day for wifi which I believe is a bit steep. We are Marriott members so we got the wifi for free. If you want to get picky, the aircraft flying over May worry you - it didn't worry us though. I think

"Bayview" suite king with sitting area. In a Marriott hotel, now what could possibly be wrong with this  $300.00 per night suite?  Allow me to provide you with a tour.  Front lobby, quite nice and then it slowly goes wrong....very wrong.  The sitting area was furnished with shoddy furniture and a large "pleather" ottoman that was peeling all over. The bathroom sink had absolutely no water pressure whatsoever. The mattress was awful and I ended up sleeping on the sofa after I put down 2 blankets. Last but not least a urine odor that still permeates my nostrils. Not sure if it was human or pet but disgusting never the less.   Come on Marriott, this property is in need of a major facelift.  New mattresses, new furniture, new carpeting. You are charging premium rates for substandard
Manager Response: Dear Nygal1133,   Thank you for taking the time to comment in regards to your recent stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent visit. Please accept our sincere apology for your less than perfect experience with us.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Newport Beach.  Sincerely,  Melissa Irish Room Operations Supervisor

Summary: The Newport Marriott Bayview is a really convienent hotel. It is near Fashion Island and best of all next to the Newport Back Bay. The back Bay has a 13 + mile bike and running path. it's perfect for a quick workout. The front desk people are very helpful. Breakfast has an omelet station that is "perfect" for my tastes. This will be my "go-to" hotel in southern Ca form now on.

This is one of the nicer Marriot's I have stayed in.  The hotel was quiet and clean and the staff was very friendly.  My only "gripe" is that they do not have enough parking. the pool and gym were top notch.  Even though the wifi was too expensive, I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great location, quiet and spacious rooms
Summary: As part of a California road trip, we decided to bunk up for the night in Newport at the Marriott.  The hotel is located on the back bay with walking trails nearby. We pulled into the parking lot and found a spot. The hotel was hopping on a Monday with business travelers rolling in. Parking is $25.  After a quick and efficient Check in by the helpful staff, we headed up to our suite on a corner with 2 beds, a massive stand up shower/tub/dual vanity bathroom, a big bar with a refrigerator and a huge living room. The decor is typical Marriott but sufficient.  The newly remodeled downstairs was quite nice too but we didn't spend much time there.  The internet was $12.95 or $16.95 a day depending on the speed you wanted. Marriott Platinum's get the top tier speed for free.  It was

Summary Heading: Nice Room but HORRIBLE sofa bed and small murphy bed.
Summary: The room was beautiful and clean. The King bed was super comfortable as to be expected. However, I was staying in the room with a bridal party of 4 other girls. I spoke directly to a hotel receptionist after booking online and told her I wanted to be sure we'd ALL have a comfortable sleep. She assured me the murphy bed was comfy and big enough for two- it was about the size of a large twin mattress. The sofa bed, which I and another bridesmaid shared, left us both with backaches on the day of the wedding because the whole night you could feel the springs protruding through the barely-there mattress. I would have paid more to upgrade to a double queen room but I was assured the sofa bed and murphy bed were comfortable. Yikes!
Manager Response: Dear Shannon C,  Thank you for taking the time to share your expereience from your past stay with us.  I apologize for the inconvenience you had with the murphy bed in the room and have forwarded this information to the apporopriate hotel team to ensure this issues is fixed going forward.  All the best, Alex

Summary: Love this location on the back bay with access to lovely walking trails!  The Hotel public areas have been recently remodeled and there is a cool but inviting vibe.  Had a burger for dinner which I thought was pricey but was delicious! Breakfast at this venue is always fantastic, thanks primarily to Javier in the kitchen who can whip up anything you like and serves it with such happiness! The rooms are comfortable and spacious.  Beds are very comfortable!  Service with the exception of the lack of help at dinner was outstanding.  A winner, every time!

It was a great weekend getaway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made suggestions for places of interest. The accommodations were spacious and clean. Close to the PCH where I found plenty of entertainment and restaurants.

Stayed there with my wife for three nights in the newly renovated hotel. The suite is spacious, bed comfortable, with no airport noise. The front desk was courteous and helpful at the check in and made us fell as welcome as the soothing Southern California sea-breeze that we missed so much.  Our experience however was marred by the rude awakening by flee bits for the first two nights. The front desk switched us another suite for the third night, after they responded,matter of factly, that the room service and engineer (?) did not find any flee. No apology/compensation offered. The third night was flee-bit free and we finally had a good night of sleep.  So our advice is to stay away if you are not flee-resistant. This is a very pet-friendly hotel, we realized after checking out.
Manager Response: Dear Kuan W, Thank you for taking the time to share your past experience with us and please accept my most sincere apology regarding your stay. Would you please be able to contact me at the hotel so we can further discuss your past visit?  Thanks, Alex Ghaffarian Alex.Ghaffarian@marriott.com

Summary: I stayed at the property in mid April with a group from my Church. The hotel was awesome. The view was great and the room was very nice (french doors inside the room, two nice flatscreen tvs, nice bathroom area). It is a very nice property and the front desk staff were very friendly.  The manager Alex and his staff are very good.  We walked the nearby hiking trail and we had a good view of the lagoon. I have stayed at many Marriott properties and this one is at the top of my list ...   As you can tell I am happy with my stay. My wife was pleased with it.

We arrived late after an all day drive.  We were checked in immediately.  I had checked in on line about 4 pm.  The room was large with a separate bedroom and everything was comfortable, clean and orderly. The next morning we had an outstanding buffet breakfast with made to order omelets.  The food preparer was jovial, funny, charming and made a killer omelet.  The best part is that there really is a benefit to bring a gold member.   I loved this Marriott.  The view is just of the Newport bay but the rooms and service made up for the bay only view.  We will definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Past its best, but service tries it's best
Summary: Stayed on business in a bay view suite. The view is not worth the extra money as it is not a great view and you can't see the ocean.  Room was large and clean. Deferred maintenance means that carpets and paintwork are starting to look rough.   Location is close to the fashion island shopping mall. There is onsite parking which costs $25 per day. Internet is reliable and fast and costs around $20 per day.  Buffet breakfast costs between $18 and $22 per person. The choice is very limited to eggs, bacon and grits plus a few fruit bowls, yogurts and cereals. The location means that you would need to drive to get to another venue for breakfast.  Staff are very polite and helpful. At breakfast it was very pushy and it's hard to have a quiet breakfast with a newspaper and be
Manager Response: Dear Gibmini,  Thank you for your valued feedback about your past stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  The property is located about 4 miles inland from the beach and our rooms only have the views of the Newport Beach Backbay and not of the ocean.   We appologize if this caused inconveniences during your stay and look forward to better serving you next time your travels brings you to the Newport Beach area.  Sincerely, Alex Ghaffarian

Summary: I go out of my way to stay at Marriott's but this one was really sub-par and I wouldn't stay there again. Very consistent experience as many comments here... very well trained and nice staff who addressed every issue, but I don't want nor should there be any issues. No pillows or extra blankets were in the room for the pull out bed (I was traveling with my family).  I got a wake-up call in the early morning when I had not arranged for one.  There were ZERO soaps and shampoos... they just forgot them.  Each time I had to call the desk and they were helpful and immediately took care of it but....  Parking $25 is absurd.The curtain was in shreds (amazed that they had not seen and fixed it).  The room was very clean and the food was very good. It was just not what I've come to
Manager Response: Dear gogalmom,  Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  I am terribly sorry to hear about the inconveniences you faced during your stay with us. I have passed on your feedback to the Housekeeping department in regards to the towels, sheets, and shampoos ensuring this is corrected going forward. I am also very sorry to hear about the wake up alarm dispatched to your room causing additional inconveniences throughout your stay.  We hope to have an opportunity to better serve you next time your travels brings you back to the Orange County area and if I may be of any assistance, please reach out to me directly by dialing 949-509-6067.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback.  Sincerely, Alex Ghaffarian Front Office Manager

Summary: I'm coming to the end of a 10 day stay at this lovely Marriott property in Newport Beach and I'm very happy.  The only reason why I haven't given this hotel 5 stars is that it needs some room updates and room renovations, but that's OK, I'm sure they're on their way and the rooms are so spotless that it isn't a big issue anyway. There are numerous positives at this property for a business traveler: The location is ideal as it sits close, but not too close, to major highways. Heading towards the beach, it takes 5 minutes, at most, to reach the PCH which will take you to some wonderful places north or south along the coast. The property itself is small enough to allow for quick access to your room, the pool, gym, restaurant, parking lot, etc... This is important because we

Like a few other reviews, this property is fine right off the 405 freeway. My room was a suite and it was nice and clean. I had views of the bay and away from the freeway so it was quiet and peaceful. The $25 parking fee was a little crazy and I was too tired to drag around my luggage from the parking structure nearby.  Seems to be the haven for business folks which is fine. The location is the best attribute.
Manager Response: Dear Chacha562013,  Thank you for taking the time to share your past experience at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview. I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel department. We look forward to welcoming you next time your travels brings you back to the Orange County area.  All the best wishes,  Alex Ghaffarian Front Office Manager

Summary: I normally don't write reviews, but decided that this hotel deserves a good rating. We arrived on Friday afternoon after a long drive from San Francisco, and originally had reservations at a different Marriott in Huntington Beach. On arrival, the room we were given was a) different from what we booked. I reserved a suite and we got a studio, which was a big deal because we had two kids with us and wanted privacy, b) was looking right at the 405 freeway so it was very noisy and again a non-starter with two kids, and c) smelled like smoke. We couldn't stay there and booked the Marriott Newport Beach right there. It was only a 10-minute drive but what a difference! The lady at the front desk was cheerful and kind. Unfortunately I didn't remember her name (sorry!), but she had

Average hotel in a beautiful area and convenient location.  I've stayed here a few times over the past three years but this was likely my last.  The rooms are becoming dated, the surface parking expensive, and there is no Concierge Club available for Marriott Platinum members.   Even with a relatively normal day and overnight in SoCal, the air unit could not keep the room cool, reaching a 'low' of 76 degrees.  My smoke alarm started beeping at 1:30 am and maintenance had to be called to switch the unit.  Seems the battery needed to be replaced.  Although the gentleman made quick work of the switch, it was still a very disruptive event.  I've deliberately waited nearly one week to post a true and level-review of the hotel, not simply based on these two bad issues with the room
Manager Response: Thank you Robery for taking the time to share your feedback about your past stay with us.   I apologize to hear about the smoke alarm detector going off in the early morning hours and I could only imagine the frustration that it might cause. Please accept my sincere apology. I have shared your feedback with our Engineering department and will ensure the batteries are replaced on a schedule to avoid issued like these to occur going forward.  Unfortunately, with the property being an all-suite product, there is no Concierge Lounge available. We do however offer complimentary breakfast through our restaurant to all out Gold and Platinum Marriott Rewards member guests.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we look forward to welcoming you to the hotel whenever your travels brings you to the Newport Beach area.  All the best, Alex Ghaffarian Alex.Ghaffarian@marriott.com

Summary Heading: Close enough to walk the Back Bay each morning
Summary: We chose this hotel, because of the location to the places we would be visiting each day while in Newport.  Early mornings were spent walking and jogging along the wonderful Newport Back Bay.  It is a treasure and right outside the hotel.  Can't say as for the construction noise, since we left for the entire day and evenings.  Parking is expensive, and we did not eat here, as we were out with friends and family all day and night.   Rooms should be equipped with more than a 2 cup coffee maker the Starbucks was not open during our stay.  Our king suite did have a little refrigerator which we stocked for breakfast.  There needs to be more hooks on the walls to hang towels and clothing.

We were staying at the Marriott Bayview to attend a conference at the Broadcom offices.  The hotel was fairly conveniently located, clean, and they let me know that there was construction occurring during my stay, but that is would not affect me because of the timing.  I was well taken care of, and the Broadcom rate was a nice discount off of standard rates.  As a business traveler, it was a very pleasant experience.

So I stayed at this Marriott because of the reviews and I'm so disappointed. It's so expensive and the charge u for everything!  The rooms are so mediocre as well as their menu wow. Made us change rooms the next morning and didn't tell us about the $150 dog fee until after we stayed the night. The "Bayview rooms" not all that. I've stayed at 4 star hotels that were way cheaper, free wifi, complimentary water & cocktails with breakfast that wasn't this expensive. Pay for parking and it's self park too.
