Yeah we cut our stay short. Trust me ur better off staying somewhere else!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest:  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   I am sorry you had not noticed the $150 pet cleaning fee on out website prior to making your reservation. I have also shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel departments ensuring the inconveniences you faced are corrected moving forward.  Sincerely, Alex G.

Summary Heading: We spent one night in a large suite on our wedding night!
Summary: The suite was very nice.  Not spectacular, but still very nice.  Especially quiet at night.  The one night we spent there was a wedding gift from a friend and so we spent our wedding night there since we were going on a delayed honeymoon later in the year (to Italy).  The bathroom tub was especially large and held the two of us quite comfortably.  Complimentary breakfast the next morning was a full, hot breakfast, not just coffee and cold donuts.  Service checking in and out were fast and efficient.  Although our house was five minutes away, it was nice to spend the night in a hotel in our own city just so we could recommend it to friends if they asked us for the name of a nearby hotel.  Now we can say we know first hand what it was like to spend the night in a hotel on the

So I stay here quite a bit. That being said I know the place well.   Had issues before but managers did attend to them, but I must say I was not completely satisfied with the outcome completely but that is just being sensitive is all maybe.  They are finishing up remodeling the hotel and looks nice I must say. Should be completed by my next visit.  Some issues are parking is a bit much especially for the lack of parking.  But one of my things I like about the hotel is some of the employees in particular Connor(I think that is the right spelling).  He is absolutely great. Always remembers me even after long breaks in between visits, he makes the whole experience better like remembering my usual room and if not available tries to find the same room in different floor. Great

Summary Heading: In desperate need of a full renovation.
Summary: Upon arriving I went the parking lot as they did not provide valet parking, walking through this parking lot with my luggage I did not feel safe at all and gave a terrible first impression to a very disappointing hotel.  The room was very clean and spacious with a living room, large bathroom and a light filled bedroom with a very nice sea view. The room was clean but very dated and in dire need of a renovation but I did notice some construction going on so I guess they are renovating some rooms. Also the lifts are very old and need to be updated and I did not feel safe in them.   Connor at the reception tried his best to make my stay good as did the runners.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your feedback about your previous stay with us at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  As you noticed, the hotel is going through a renovation of the lobby and public areas and the work is to be done by April 1st.   We look forward to unveiling a brand new product to you when your travels brings you back to the Orange County area.  Regards, Alex G.

Summary Heading: Cross This One Off Your List
Summary: At check-in I was told that this property was a step up over others Marriotts because all the rooms are suites. Yes, they are suites, but dog-eared suites. The leather on the footstools in the sitting area was dirty and peeling. The battery in the cordless phone on the desk was dead. When I spoke to At Your Service that evening, it was like I was speaking another language. And then she argued with me. The bathtub faucet leaked - not just the drip, drip, drip, but a steady flow of noisy and wasted water that woke me up several times during the night. There is no door to close that off. This suite was a real step up alright. Then here came breakfast - a room service disaster. I did not want the free buffet, I wanted breakfast to my room, prepared how I always order it at any
Manager Response: Dear cporter187,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your past stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  Based on your input, I have come to realize that unfortunately we have fallen short of meeting and exceeding your expectations. Please accept my most sincere apologies for all the inconveniences during you stay. I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   I would love to speak with you about your past visit and am hoping you could contact me at the hotel at your convenience.  Thank you, Alex Ghaffarian

Summary: I read some of the recent reviews and think that maybe one of us stayed in a different hotel.  Is the hotel under renovation?  Yes.  But honestly while I was there the lobby was opened up and the reception area was fine.  There was a little construction pretty early in the morning but that was to be expected.  My room was great.  Nice to have all of that space to stretch out.   What I personally thought was the best was the hotel staff.  The folks I worked with (and I was kind of high maintenance on this trip) were courteous, helpful, and always had a smile.  I could not be more pleased.  Thank you for a great stay!

Second time, we stay in this hotel and this is the same mess. The only + they are renovating the common area, and i hope they will renovate the outdated furniture in rooms. My major complaint is about reception desk, some guys need a serious training, We pay for a room on  bay view and get one on the parking view... When we ask for a change 9we are platinium) we were very poorly treated
Manager Response: Dear lolotte17000,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the hotel to ensure this issue is signled out going forward.   Sincerely,   Alex Ghaffarian alex.ghaffarian@marriott.com

Summary Heading: Our room was the only highlight.
Summary: This was our first stay at this property so we do not have anything to compare to. Unfortunately, the layout and location of our room was the only thing that we really liked. The lobby is non-existent with a cramped check in process. We also did not see one bellman or doorman during our stay. This must not be a service that Marriott Bayview provides? The walk to the pool was long through construction walls and stair wells and breakfast was served in what appeared to be a small conference room with tables and chairs. Based on our first impression, we are unlikely to return.
Manager Response: Dear GreatTraveltime,  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Sincerely,  Alex G.

Summary: We just had a wierd experience all the way around. We were attending a conference at the *other* marriot just down the road (on the same street, actually), but ended up with a room booked at the bayview. In the scheme of things, that wasn't too big of a deal, except that we tried to change the reservation but got major resistance. Wierd, and not what I would expect, but hey - not that big of a deal.  When we checked in @ 11pm, the 2 day reservation that my email stated was in the system as 1 day. Again - not too big of a deal, but wierd.  My wife wanted to take a shower before bed, but the water was luke warm at best. okay.... in the morning, it was no longer luke warm, but was now simply cold. When I called the Front Desk, they said they would send up an engineer.  As I had to
Manager Response: Dear Devin,   Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Newport Beach.   Sincerely, Alex G.

Summary: What a fantastic property. From valet to check in to the room and through checkout everything was perfect. Eric and Mr. O'Brien were great at check in and explained all details that were needed to us. The pool was great and the hot tub clean. The restaurants on property are great. Room was upgraded to a suite. Beautiful room overlooking the golf course with an ocean view.  Starbucks in lobby opens early in the morning. Hotel is right across from Fashion Island which has any restaurant you could ever want.  Free breakfast for Platinum members. Concierge club closed on weekends.  Just a great stay. I was treated the best i Have ever been treated at a Marriott.

Summary Heading: Spacious and comfortable; will be even better when renovation is done
Summary: We stayed for a short break and enjoyed it.  We liked our suite with plenty of space and a nice view of the bay.  Temporary lobby/dining area was a drag but it should be nice when the renovation is done.  Easy access from the highway.

I have stayed here many times, and was caught off guard when I rolled up to the Hotel recently and discovered it is under heavy Renno.  (I hadn't made a Reservation in advance this visit)  The temp. Check-In area is crammed literally, into about 200 sq. feet.  Looks like a big storage room.  Computer wires/extension cording are sloppily hanging in view and are both dangerous AND tacky looking.  I was amazed @ this 'make-shift' arrangement for a 'Marriott' property, it was spookey and weird!  The entire Hotel is a mess - there were Dining tables thrown out into the hallway where people have to walk;  I mean, who wants to have dinner in a Hallway as people tromp by!!!   Gross. Restaurant dining 'shoved' into what's no larger than a big Walk-In Closet.  There is no Lobby to lounge
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   If you like to discuss this further, please contact me directly at the hotel or by the email below.  Sincerely, Alex Ghaffarian alex.ghaffarian@marriott.com

Summary: Currently this hotel is under renovation, so it may be a bit unfair to give it a review which is too harsh. Gym was adequate. Originally booked in for 3 nights, but changed to one. Reception area is relocated to a small room at the back of the hotel. Furniture in the room was worn and tired. Fridge was very small, and no mini-bar. Hopefully after renovation, hotel will look perkier. Not worth the $199 currently being charged.

Summary Heading: Do yourself a favor, wait for the rennovation to be finished
Summary: I have stayed her before and overall it was a great stay, I loved it. However they are in the middle of a renovation and you need to know this going in.  The location of the front desk and dinning is not convenient. Parking is a bit of a drag as is the trek to the gym down hallways and stairwells. They are not serving Starbucks which I really enjoy so that was a drag too.....just pays to wait.   Staff is all great and I love them all.....problem is, the room are not being renovated just the lobby so all this stuff and you won't even get an updated room..shame!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview with us.   I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.   As you noticed, we are currently undergoing a major renovation of our lobby, front desk, and restaurant areas. These areas are sure to provide a highly functional space and stylish décor that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Newport Beach Marriott Bayview on your next visit to Newport Beach so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Sincerely,  ALEX GHAFFARIAN  alex.ghaffarian@marriott.com

Summary: We stayed here for my fiancée's birthday.  The hotel was nice and the rooms were very big.  My sister is using this hotel for her wedding guests next month.  My only complaint is the price of parking is a bit steep considering how far the hotel is from everything.

My husband and I stayed for 1 night for a short getaway.  We used our Marriott points, so it was great.  The room is really nice, as the sleeping area was separated from the living area by french doors.  My reasons for 4 stars instead of 5 is due to its location and parking fee - you can't really walk to anything.  It's also a bit far from the beach itself - but it didn't matter to us as we were just there for a staycation.  Parking fee seemed a bit high to us.  Staff were courteous, no complaints there. Overall, nice stay.  Note: They are currently going to renovations to their lobby, so the entrance and path to the room is a bit awkward.

Summary Heading: Why stay open during major refurbishment / remodelling?
Summary: The rooms are truely lovel - large, well set out with recently improved fittings. Unfortunately I had to get to the room through a soon to be building site. I do not understand why Marriott risks its reputation to stay open during major refurbishment - there is no main reception area, the restaurant is an old stuffy meeting room. To get to the room you walk thru the restaurant and up the service escalator and so it goes. My advice - DO NBOT STAY HERE UNTIL REMODELLING IS Complete.
Manager Response: Dear baguette15,   Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview with us.   I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  As you noticed, we are currently about to undergo a major renovation of our lobby, restaurant, and front desk areas. These areas are sure to provide a highly functional space and stylish décor that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.  Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your stay, I hope you will consider Newport Beach Marriott Bayview on your next visit to Newport Beach so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.  Sincerely, Alex G.

Summary: Huge luxury room, great views, cheap rate, amazing friendly staff. This Marriott treats you like the Ritz Carlton. If you stay at a Ritz often you'll notice that this Marriott's Service and staff are more like the Ritz than a standard hotel. If your a Gold or Platinum status guest free breakfast is also included. The restaurant is really good at this property as well. Another note on the staff is that they remember you :-). The maids really clean the room well too. Lots of business travelers here but also VERY family friendly. Everything works at this property. I spoke to the front desk manager Alex and he shared that this hotel really takes pride in caring for its guests. It's clear that the management here is VERY engaged and that shows. Finally Conner at the front desk is

Recently stayed 1 night at the Marriott Bayview. There are 2 Marriott's in Newport, so make sure you're looking at the right one.   Check in was fast and Noelle at the front desk was extremely kind and recognized my status.   My room was great and met all of my preferences in my Marriott profile.    You can't go wrong with this hotel's proximity to SNA and all that Newport has to offer.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for Newport on Bay
Summary: Centrally located for just about everything in OC and Newport. On the Back Bay: a great ecologic nature preserve for walking or biking or running and close to beach, shopping and UC Irvine. Value is good. Hotel staff is professional, friendly, and responsive. Rooms are lovely, just the right size because you will be outside most of your visit here. Enjoy. Take advantage.

We recently visited the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview and had a wonderful stay. We arrived early, but they were very accommodating in getting us into our three rooms when we got there. The property is an all suites hotel and the rooms were spacious and very clean. There were balconies in each of our rooms. There was a really nice breakfast included. The common areas of the hotel were extremely nice as well. We had drinks out in the garden area when we arrived and it was just beautiful. The hotel property was great, but their staff was the best part of our stay. We were greeted by Dylan at the front desk, who was very pleasant, knowledgeable and made check in a breeze. Then Silver and Danny helped us at the lobby bar. They were a lot of fun and helpful. And finally at breakfast

This hotel was very high end and super clean. I enjoyed the room service and the hotel view. the room was  a perfect size and I liked how the bed room was separate from the living room. You must see it

Love the all suite rooms.   The Staff here is what makes it. Every front desk man or woman I have had in my numerous stays here have done an amazing friendly job.   I like quiet rooms and they always satisfy that.  I stay at many hotels and marriotts this is my favorite. The bed is so comfortable. The separate room for me to do work in the morning while my lady sleeps is great.  The continental breakfast is also good with a good selection and omelette station   Will definitely choose this hotel first in OC and right off the 55!!

Stayed here for a weekend in October. Big, spacious rooms, beautiful views of the Bay.  Convenient self parking, right outside the lobby.  Mediocre breakfast buffet. Small swimming pool. I would stay here again if traveling with family.

Love the look and feel of this property. Rooms are clean and well laid out, very comfortable. There are only 2 downsides for me - parking is 23 bucks with no valet and there is no concierge room here! Otherwise its a perfect property for me and how I like to stay when I travel. The hotel is located near the John Wayne Airport and is a short ride to the beach.

It was our 2nd wedding anniversary and end of our trip when we checked into this hotel.  I was using points for our one-night stay at this hotel and I just happened to mention that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary at check-in.  The person registering us, upgraded us to a suite and gave my wife and I some goodies as well as a voucher to have breakfast on the hotel the next morning.  This was totally unexpected since I was using points for the one-night stay.  The hotel looked especially new or extremely well kept.  It was clean and obviously very friendly.  It was located in a business area of town and looked like only wealthy people or people on expense accounts would stay there.  We were extremely well cared for and made to feel important.  I would highly recommend

This hotel's rooms have the same design/floor plan as the Marriott Suites--a decent sized bedroom and separate living room/office area. The baths in this property are nicer than in the Marriott Suites with a large shower and separate tub, as well as a separate dressing room. The view over Newport Bay is great and the hotel itself is attractive and upscale. All Marriott staff people are friendly and so was the staff here--but average by Marriott standards. Excellent beds and bedding, plus a Murphy bed in the living room. Furnishing generally very nice, but an ottoman was a bit worn. Really good overall.

I loved my time at the Marriott Bayview.  The rooms are spacious with a separate living room and bedroom, nice sized bathroom with a separate shower and tub, and a balcony to look out.  The bedding is high quality and very comfortable, great towels, and really nice amenities.  The hotel is close to trails if you like to take a morning stroll, or you can easy drive to Fashion Island for shopping/dinner.  It's a nice location, although not a lot to walk to, so hopefully you have a car or can use Uber.  I found the parking pricey at $23 per day, but everything is pricey in Newport Beach.  Just add it into the cost of the room.  Additionally, there is free wifi in the lobby if you don't want to pay the per day costs.  It would be nice to see a bundled rate that included parking and

Our family of 4 stayed for week at Newport Beach and had a wonderful time. Visited LA & Hollywood which were around an hour drive away. The resort is well kept, clean and staff were friendly, the villas were everything you expect from Marriott standards (high) We enjoyed our stay and would love to return.    Beautiful resort which set on the hillside within a 10 min drive to the nearest beach. Many excellent local restaurants to choose from.

Welcoming staff, facility beautifully sited, great views from the rooms -- we lover everything about the Marriott Bayview in Newport Beach.  Plus, it's close to the Back Bay and great bird-watching and walking trails.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location, Run, Run, Run
Summary: I stay at this property monthly when visiting my Team in Irvine.  It is extremely easy to get to from John Wayne (SNA) airport, and I can get pretty much I need to get to pretty quickly (once the rush hour traffic empties out).  Rooms are very comfortable and spacious, and ones facing the water are particularly nice because you get a reasonable view.  Business desk is set up very nice with outlets located in lamp base, and also comes with Ethernet (which I prefer) and WiFi.  I have eaten twice in the lobby bar; nothing to write home about but decent and convenient.  BUT where this property shines is purely the location WRT to large trail network that runs through the area.  Just outside the hotel (by the bay) you pick up a trail that either with a bit of rolling terrain takes

I stayed here for a wedding for one night and was pleasantly surprised by the rooms. These rooms are modern and very large with excellent views and the bay side. Our room had a living area with a large tv, couches and balcony over looking the pool and bay. The bath and shower(separate) were state of the art and immaculate. The bed is in its own room with a view as well. The event planner (Amanda) who coordinated the wedding was extremely helpful and obviously has talent for planning and executing events.

Stayed here for a wedding and glad we did. Great service, beautiful hotel! The rooms were clean and spacious with a beautiful view. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely beyond our expectations!

I called the hotel to see if the type of room I wanted was available. I spoke with Conner who went above and beyond to reserve a terrific room. When we arrived I was so please to see Conner was also working the front desk that day. I must add that the rest of the staff was also very pleasant and helpful. Our room was a king suite with a bay view that was simply lovely and so comfortable. The only problem we had was in the room next door to us. They came in around 2 - 3 AM and what started out sounding like a party quickly turned into a brawl. Hotel staff quickly handled the situation and the offending parties left the hotel. Otherwise, the hotel is pretty quiet.

Summary Heading: So cute, you forget the OC traffic that it took to get there!
Summary: Enjoyed the weekend here, exploring back bay and our fav:newport beach!!! Rooms are a bit older, but style and decor was beachy-like Dana Point Marriott. Quite and easy to get to. Guest service was Marriott standard.

Summary Heading: Great Marriott in a great location.
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at this Marriott for a quick overnight stay.   We really enjoyed the hotel.  The hotel is along a bay and is well designed.  Our room was excellent too.  Beds are extremely comfortable.   The location is convenient as well for all the area has to offer.  We ha breakfast in the hotel and that was very good as well.  My only complaint is the parking is $23.99 per day.  Ouch!  Outside of that my only other complaint is that we couldn't stay here longer.

Ask for a bay view.  It's on an estuary so sometimes it just looks like mud but the tide comes in and out so it fills up with water and looks really cool.    Our room had a separate bedroom which added to it's charm.  Very clean room with a small living room with a tv and then the bedroom had a tv.  Nice view.  Large bathroom.  The lobby was nice.  Staff was super friendly.  I would stay here again anytime.    ITS NOT WALKING DISTANCE TO ANY PLACE EXCEPT THE "BACK BAY" walking path.  AND ANOTHER BUMMER IS THAT YOU HAVE TO PAY A LOT FOR PARKING.  Which I find lame because you park you car, it's not valet or anything and it was, as I recall, $20 pr day so add that to your budget.

Summary Heading: Brand new shirt was stolen from room.
Summary: We stayed for five nights at Newport Beach Marriott, which based on the hotel staff's response to us, is a very long time for someone to stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is certainly nothing special, but it was adequate and the staff was friendly enough. The issue is that my brand new shirt that had been tailored for me to specifically wear on this trip was taken from our room before I ever had a chance to wear it.  We went through every article of clothing and checked each drawer at least three times before notifying the staff of the missing shirt.  I gave the maid the benefit of the doubt as I explained to them the the shirt was predominantly white so it must have mistaken for some of their linens.  They said they would check the laundry and talk to the maid.  After a few
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Frankie,  I wanted to reach out to you regarding your stay with us. I apologizes on behalf of the hotel not handling you issue with more concern. This is not how we perform and I can ensure you that we will resolve your issue. I would like to regain your trust so if you could please send me your contact information so that I can discuss this further.  Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: The All Suite Rooms Are Spacious, Comfortable, Clean and Quiet
Summary: Went here for business.  I didn't know what to expect since I had never been to this area before.  The hotel rooms were really nice.  They are all suites with a huge bathroom, bedroom, living room area.  Even there closet is huge.  The bathroom set up is a bit weird for me, separate sink and toilet/shower/tub area which was weird more because it was carpeted in that area than the distance to walk but that is just me.    You have to walk outside to get to their workout room which is packed a bit packed tightly but it works.  You can also run or walk across the street, there is a path that runs through a nice bit of stretch and everyone is out there in the morning working out, friendly way to start the day.    It is in the middle of nowhere, right off the freeway and you need a

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay for the weekend
Summary: Off the beaten path of the beach about 3 miles away. Nice and quiet.  The restaurant closes between lunch and dinner and during that time there is no room service so don't arrive early thinking you can eat right there. Nice pool.  It was a nice stay and I would stay there again.

This Marriot is well appointed, clean and fresh with great customer service from the staff. We had a great king suite with a view of the bay on the 9th floor. A good value for the spacious and immaculate room. Not near the beach, but within easy driving distance.

My husband and I stayed here for the bulk of our honeymoon in Newport Beach. We had a bayview room with a balcony, and it was stunning! Kind of an awkward staff (housekeeping & brunch in particular), but over a nice bunch of people who were helpful and got us what we needed. Nice pool and nice location.

The hotel was okay but it wasn't to my exceptions for how much we paid. I probably would not go back there and try to find a better hotel but it was right next to Newport Beach with was very fun. This hotel was not that good that i would recommend it to someone.
Manager Response: Dear Nishis35805,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on Trip Advisor and sharing your experience with the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  I apologize that your recent stay was not satisfactory and appreciate your feedback.    Please accept my apology that we didn't live up to your expectations.  We would like to regain your trust and we hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to this area.     Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: Great room but restaurant not so good
Summary: This was the second stop on our California trip and we were delighted with our room. Very spacious and well equipped although the towels could usefully be larger Exceptionally comfortable bed. However we were disappointed with the restaurant . Service was consistently poor and no thought had been given for catering for gluten free needs. Once again it is surprising to be charged for in room Wifi and even more surprising to pay for parking at a hotel so far out of town. If you have a car access to the beach is no problem. Good value for money overall .

I stayed here last weekend and it was a great hotel. Close to the major shopping, far enough yet close enough to major freeways, and close to the airport. The hotel rooms our spacious and inviting. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom nice and roomy. The next morning we found out they had a breakfast buffet, which was delicious. A nice variety of choices and they will even make you and omelet! Delicious! The only complain I have is the price for parking. $23 a night to park your car is a bit steep. Otherwise, a great stay and look forward to the next time I get to come and stay at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Very Clean and well laid out property
Summary: This property is a bit different from other Marriott properties, since every room in the hotel is a 1 bedroom suite, yet the rates were very reasonable.  The living space / seating area is separated by frosted French doors to the bed room.  There are flat screen TVs located in both spaces.  It is in a great location for the Newport Beach area... close to Fashion Island and only about 14 minutes to the coast and beach areas.  The rooms were nicely furnished and the hotel is very clean.  The only negative that I have encountered is that it is $23 for self parking per day, and in many places you get Valet for less than that.  Overall, I plan on using this hotel each time I return for business to the Newport Beach area.

Summary Heading: A nice cool hotel to stay and hangout in Southern CA
Summary: This hotel is near to everything, beach, shopping, food, running trails. We love staying here and I always enjoy my runs along the bay. It's absolutely stunning when the sun sets. It's close to freeway access as well.

Everything was perfect at this hotel. We used the Marriott app to advise that we'd be there a bit before the 4pm check-in, and the room was ready.  Breakfast buffet delicious, plenty of walking & biking trails to explore. Loved the spacious suites.  Only downside is that it's a bit difficult to get to the beach if you don't have a car.

Beautiful property, excellent suites, ask for the bayside view.  The beds are wonderful, we had a suite with king sized bed.  Bed was very comfortable, bedding was awesome, cool and comfortable.  Bathrooms are very spacious and spa-like.  Staff very friendly and knowledgable.  Pool very nice, comfortable seating area and nice views.  Wonderful walking/jogging trails around bay adjacent to hotel.  Desk staff have maps and even provide you with bottled water. Recommend taking taxis to local attractions, parking is a premium and hard to find at local attractions - it was only $15 for five of us in a taxi van to Balboa Island.
Manager Response: Davis4co,  Thank you for you wonderful review. We get a lot of great comments on our comfortable beds and spacious suites. The Back Bay preserve is a wonderful way to exercise or just take a walk. I will be sure to pass on your comments to our front desk team as well.  Sincerely, John J Director of Hotel Operations

Summary: Please do not anticipate enjoying a meal, beverage or sporting game by yourself in the lobby bar.  It attracts men who use rough language and a management who allows it.  I travel every month on business and would not recommend this hotel to a woman traveling alone.  I did not feel safe or respected.
Manager Response: Dear Carla J,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our Guest Satisfaction Survey and sharing your experience with the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview.  You indicated in your response that your stay with us was unsatisfactory.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience you may have experienced.  We take great pride in ensuring our guest’s satisfaction.  Unfortunately, we did not meet your expectations.  Our goal is to address your concerns so that we can ensure you have an exceptional experience on your next visit.  You’re a valued customer; everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience.  We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.  If I may be of assistance, please don’t hesitate to contact me.    Sincerely, JOHN JOSBERGER Director of Hotel Operations Newport Beach Bayview Marriott john.josberger@marriott.com 949-509-6044

Summary: The rooms are big including the bath room . We were given a guide on what to see and where to eat.. We ate right there at the hotel the food and service were very good . You can walk the bay by going across the street and getting on the path if you don't mind walking you can go a great distance.

Summary Heading: Customer Service: Like it used to be
Summary: To the Front desk and Management:  Alex: Your amazing friendly family like attitude towards our family made us feel right at home during a stressed out time escaping the fires in San Diego to just get a way for a couple days. You answered ALL our questions about the hotel over the phone and in person, if we needed anything you didn't hesitate for a second to answer or help us out.  The 2 Lindsays at front desk: Thank you for your friendly smiles and helping us with many questions about the area we have never visited before Connor/Mario: Stellar Stellar customer service as it once used to be.  I know, a 5 star review is rare and should be used lightly.. I understand this, but I can't not give this place a perfect review. And believe me, I don't give these out often, this might be
Manager Response: Bahama s,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review. We are celebrating our associates this week and I will make sure that everyone gets recognized for their Brilliant service that you mentioned.   We look forward to your next visit to Newport Beach.  Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: WATCH OUT - there are two Marriott's in Newport Beach
Summary: Heads up, there are two Marriott's in Newport Beach, one overlooking the golf corse and near fashion island, then there is this one. While the other is rather swanky and generally more expensive the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview offers spacious suites with nice views and great value in pricy newport.   Indoor/outdoor pool was nice and the location is near the airport and quick drive to Corona Del Mar, Newport and the beach.  Food is just OK - but nearby restaurant Juliette is amazing!   The hotel has not had the "Marriott upgrades" so if you prioritize price, location, space and comfort over the latest fashion this is the place for you.

This hotel is really quite nice. The people are super friendly, the gym is fantastic, the breakfast buffet was delicious and the location was nice and peaceful.   I would have given this hotel 5 stars, except that me and my roommate both woke up with fleas on us and flea bites all over us! Lesson learned, never stay at a pet friendly hotel, unless you want fleas to have a field day all over you!
Manager Response: Dora4U,  I want to apologize for your experience at our hotel. We take every precaution relating to pets and every pet room is cleaned thoroughly to ensure that the next guest in the room can feel completely safe that there is no evidence of the previous guest.  I would like to discuss this concern with you and if you could call me at the hotel and ask for hotel manager John.  I sincerely apologize again that your stay with us was flawed and want to make it right.  Thank You, John

Summary: I stayed at this hotel twice in a span of 3 months; once in July and chose to stay there again in September when I was back in Cali. The first time I stayed there was immediately after having Lasik eye surgery at the eye center next door.  The hotel staff was made aware that my vision was limited and were very accommodating and understanding. Because I had such a pleasant experience,  I stayed there again in September when passing through Cali and again I was not disappointed. Great staff,  wonderfully sized rooms,  clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay in the OC
Summary: Stayed at this hotel twice in one month, once for business and once again for vacation, and both times were positive experiences. This is an all-suite hotel so the rooms are larger than your typical Marriott hotel with a separate bedroom connected to a living room area by a set of double doors. The open space concept is a definite plus if you are on extended travel or on vacation with 3 or more people. The only negative, which seems typical of most hotels and not just this one, is that the shower water pressure is a little weak on the higher floors.  The hotel is easily accessible from the highway and about a 5 minute drive to the local shopping area (Fashion Island) and about 15 minutes away from Newport Beach. The hotel location is in a residential/business neighborhood so

Summary Heading: I don't know how they could have made it any better!
Summary: From the personal greeting, attention to detail, friendly staff, EXTRA QUIET rooms, and phenomenal breakfast buffet, this Mariott has it all.  I went there for quiet, and I found it and so much more.  It was all the above plus the attitude of their in-house Starbucks barista, Simon, who was not only friendly and engaging, but went out of his way to make it the way I wanted it.  The omelet maker behind the buffet prepared custom omelets to PERFECTION!  The front desk staff was always there to great passers-by with a warm smile and "hello".  And, the cleaning staff was fast, efficient and very friendly, going out of their way to accommodate requests.  Thank you for a great stay!  As the governator would say, "I'll be back!"

This is my 2nd honeymoon, my husband and i are extremely happy that we chose the marriott bay view. The room is absolutely beautiful and the view is like no other!! Room 507 is perfect and our little slice of heaven....THANK U MARRIOTT BAY VIEW FOR A WONDERFUL TIME!!!!

I have stayed at this hotel a few times now, and every time the staff has gone out of their way to make me feel comfortable and happy.  It is located on the bay- rooms overlooking the bay are very nice at sunset!  This hotel is also close to Fashion Island , which boasts many shops and restaurants.

The Newport Beach Marriott Bayview Hotel is not located by the beach, but overlooks a lagoon.  Set approximately 3-4 miles from the beach, it is located close enough to the beach and John Wayne Airport that it is a convenient location.  The hotel is an all suites hotel.  It is on the older side and starting to show its age.  Check-in was friendly, and I was thanked many times for using Marriott mobile app to check-in.  Unfortunately, I was not offered a welcome amenity and was grudgingly given a 1:00 PM check-out.  For some reason, Marriott along with Hilton, does not have set rules for late check-out for their top tier members.  One thing I love about Hyatt and SPG is that they offer their top tier members a 4:00 PM check-out as a rule.  There is no Executive Lounge in this
Manager Response: Dear Mystery Traveler,  For our Gold and Platinum guests we offer a complimentary late checkout and will do our best to extend it passed noon.  I apologize for the issue you had with the smoke detector and have made sure that it has been removed.  I have met with the front desk team to communicate that we need to acknowledge our reward members so that they are appreciated for their loyalty.  I hope that the next time you are in Newport Beach you will give us another chance to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely, John

Summary: We went to Newport Beach for a spring break getaway with my sons.  The suites were perfect--plenty of room for all of us, wonderfully comfortable beds, spacious bathroom/shower/tub, and a great pool/gym area.    We especially enjoyed breakfast each morning.  Danny and Daniela were great, and they treated us like old friends by the second day of our stay--they knew what my boys wanted before the boys they could even ask.  And Javiar made the most delicious waffles and omelets, and was always so kind and accommodating.  Having free breakfast included in our room rate was fabulous.  Thanks for the great stay!

Good location central to the Santa Ana airport, Newport Beach and the highways. The rooms are suites with a large bathroom including separate bath and showers. Try to get a room facing the Newport waterway, The bed was very comfortable, flat screens in both the bedroom and living area, coffee bar, mini-bar and desk. Small balcony. There is a pool and fitness center. I didn't eat in the restaurant but the bar is nice. There aren't any restaurants in the immediate area, but there is a good Japanese restaurant a few minutes walk. The front desk service was good.

My husband and I stayed here on a whim and loved it.  The staff is exceptional.  Brandon, Connor and Mark were very personable and helpful. We had a lot of questions and they were more than happy to take the time to answer them.  There was water in the lobby with fruit added which I thought was a very nice touch.  The grounds were very pretty and very clean.  There is a bar in the lobby as well as a Starbucks and there is plenty of seating in the lobby to have business meetings or to just relax.  The rooms have a separate area with a couch and desk and the bed and pillows extremely comfortable.  The one thing that really stood out about this hotel is how quiet it was.  I usually need to use earplugs because of the noise of other guests yet here I never heard another person.  The

This is the third time we have stayed at the Marriott Bayview and we really like it.  The room is large with a separate sitting area & the great Marriott pillows & bed.  Very conveniently located.  The only negative is the $23/day parking fee and they charge for wifi in the room!

Convenient location for Fashion Island and close to John Wayne Airport. This is definitely a hotel oriented to the business traveler.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The customer service is 5 star. If you want a room with a view, there are hotels closer to the beach that will serve that purpose.

We loved the style of the suite, it was very convenient with kids! The rooms were very clean and comfortable and quiet. I did have a little hassle with the front desk girl who treated me as if I was 'below' her or something. And I do wish they offered breakfast. But otherwise it was a good stay, and we would stay again If the price was reduced.

Stayed multiple times for business between 2008 and 2013 convenient location, very close to SNA airport, major shopping, the beach,and a cool walking/jogging trail, easy access to the highways. Suites are very comfortable and spacious, breakfast is good, restaurant staff extremely polite and frinedly. Front desk staff's service varies - my experience ranged from being treated with outright hostility and disdain to super nice. Go figure! The latter appears to be more consitent as of late which is a good sign but still the management should monitor that aspect. Nice pool and gym area. Good value although never had to pay myself :)

We stayed for a weekend getaway with our kids and had a great time. Loved our room. It was spacious, clean, very comfortable. An extra bonus was the murphy bed, along with the sofa bed, which meant plenty of sleeping space for our 3 kids! The kids loved the pool facilities as did we. They enjoyed swimming for hours on end and I enjoyed watching from their very comfy lounge chairs. Their breakfast buffet is delicious and the gentlemen working the omelette bar are the kindest, friendliest staff I've ever met. We enjoyed our stay. Looking forward to coming back.

Stunning hotel, great Pool areas stayed here and the Hyatt on Buisness both excellent although a little pricey. Didn't eat here was there for a Expo, incredibly clean and very good staff. That's the Truth!

Setting lovely close to Newport Creek trails, massive room and very personal and thoughfull staff. Around the swimming pool was immaculate and there was a splendid garden meeting area. Staff efficently arranged taxis for you as there were no porters but I dont think they need them to be honest as everyone helped.

A lot of things to like about this hotel. The location is ideal. Wanted to find a Marriott as close to the PCH as possible. And even though this is maybe a mile uphill off it, you still have a view of the water from up there. The hotel itself is well-maintained. The service is second to none. But of all things that put this restaurant over the top, it was the restaurant. We typically don't eat at the restaurant in the hotel for a variety of reasons (usually overpriced and undervalued). The chef, Javier, as we learned, draws people from all around who come specifically to the hotel to eat meals cooked by him. Not just that, he will come around to the tables and introduce himself. Breakfast is pretty much a la carte--meaning whatever you want, he will cook for you. On our last

Summary Heading: Great spot for romance or business
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our 38th wedding anniversary. I asked for a handicapped accessible room and we were given a roomy suite on the seventh floor with a view of Newport Beach's Back Bay. The living room had a comfy sofa with lots of pillows and a flat screen TV. The bedroom featured a super comfy King-sized bed, with loads of down pillows and a down comforter and another TV. The marble bathroom was uber comfy. The best thing was the service. Evian water and chocolate covered strawberries greeted us when we came in the room. We treated ourselves to room service for dinner and were delighted with the turkey burger and fries and the halibut and broccoli rabe, all yummy. This hotel has been here for a while and the ceilings still have cottage cheese finish on them in the

I don't think I have ever witnessed more helpful staff than I did during my stay here. I didn't have any extraordinary needs, but to a person the staff over delivered. The rooms are good - nice to have a full suite with a separate bedroom. The balconies are tiny, not really for hanging out. The water pressure was poor. Not much of a bar; the lounge area seemed more like a place for people to sit alone with their laptops than a social setting. Decent food, not outrageous hotel price gouging. All in all, a decent place to stay on business. In fact, I'm booked to stay there again next week.

Summary Heading: Our Go-To Business Hotel in Orange County
Summary: My wife and I stay here on business trips a lot.  No joke, probably close to 60 nights last year alone.  Its fairly quiet as it is mostly business travelers with some families in the summer and occasional weddings on the weekends.  Hotel staff is always courteous and attentive.  The rooms are nice with the bedroom separated from the living room.  All rooms are almost identical setup except for a couple I've seen that double as a meeting room.  An "upgrade" at this hotel will likely mean a bay view room or corner room with wrap around balcony.  Again, all rooms are suites and there are no giant executive suites.  The lobby was recently updated.  The bar is small, but adequate.  The menu was enhanced recently and is much better.  Bar and restaurant staff are superb.  Room service

Stayed overnight for a soccer tournament and it was perfect for my family of 3.  The room was very roomy but would have been more comfortable if there were two thermostats since it got warm in the bedroom and too cold in the living room.  Also, the beds need upgrading since it was very lumpy.  As Gold members we received a complimentary room upgrade, buffet breakfast for 2 adults/1 child which would normally cost $50 & complimentary wifi.  Herron's was surprisingly good for a hotel restaurant w/ a good selection of draft beer.  Mobile check-in worked perfectly so check-in was a breeze.  Service at Herron's and the front desk was very attentive.

Summary Heading: Great Weekend at Newport Marriott Bayview
Summary: We just came back from our second stay at the Newport Marriott Bayview (an all suite Marriott up the street from the other Marriott across the street from Fashion Island mall). Our family just loves this hotel! Being Marriott platinum members we stay at a lot of properties but this is our go to favorite when we are in Orange County and are not staying at the timeshare in Newport Coast. This time we stayed in what they called a parlor suite and it had a king bed seperated by french doors from a queen murphy bed and sofa sleeper. This bed layout allowed our family of 5 to all have enough space to sleep comfortably. The in room fridge was enough room to keep a couple snacks or dinner leftovers in and I noticed a microwave near the ice and soda machines if you needed to use one. Our

We are currently staying at this hotel and have spent one night here so far.  It is our new favorite hotel for Disneyland.  That's right, we're here for Disney but are tired of the Anaheim scene so we thought we'd stay someplace we'd rather be.  Here are the reasons this is a great hotel for a Disney stay:  - This is an all suite hotel.  Our room has one bedroom with a kind sized bed and a Murphy bed in the living room.  When we came back late from Disneyland last night, we were able to put the kids to bed and then watch TV without keeping the kids awake.  The room is nicely appointed and much higher quality then the suites we have stayed at near Disneyland. - It was a 20 minute drive to Disneyland. Not too bad for LA. - The breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was

I went to this hotel with my family. We booked two rooms. They were both suites. Very nice, very clean and great view of the bay from the windows. Nice lobby, cool entrance and very good breakfast setting. we liked that it was easy to get in an out of. Easy to get out a do trips to the beach, fashion island etc. The staff was nice and helpful. We would definitely consider staying there again.

Summary Heading: If you have to go to Orange County . . .
Summary: The king mini-suites are clean, well-appointed and comfortable.  beds and bedding are of decent quality, there are several places to sit and read, and the hotel offers just about all the amenities that one would expect.  I stayed there during three business trips and have no complaints, which is unusual for me.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Newport Beach
Summary: This was our second year in a row staying at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview. The front desk agents were very accommodating and friendly, especially Mario. The room was clean and spacious, that is why we stay there. The overall experience for the two nights we stayed was excellent. The only challenge with our stay was the parking. The room keys only worked 1 out of 5 times on average and there would be cars backed up trying to get in, it seems like many people were having the same challenge. When you are paying $21.00 a day for parking, this gets to be frustrating. Overall, the experience was great and we look forward to staying again next year.

Summary Heading: Wait Until You Can Stay in the Tower!
Summary: We stayed in this hotel four years ago and was assigned a room in the tower on one of the higher floors with a wonderful ocean view across the golf course and pool.  We were very happy with the hotel.  Again, we were staying to celebrate our anniversary, but this time we were placed in the low-rise (three floors) wing which did not provide the same level of enjoyment.  We looked up at the tower rooms and there was a great deal of renovation taking place.  We recommend you wait until the renovations are complete because the room in the low-rise building was not as nice or big and it was noisier during odd hours of the night.  Also, that end of the hotel houses the restaurant with cooking smells coming into the room instead of the ocean breeze.  The location of the hotel is still

If you're looking for a swanky, full-service resort, this is not your place.  But if you're looking for a great business hotel or a place near SNA airport for a night or two, I can't recommend this place enough.  The location is in a complex of office buildings, only a football field to UC-Irvine, a 10 min drive away from the airport, 10 min from Fashion Island, 15 min from the coast of Newport Beach.  If you're in Southern California, you have a car, so this is not an issue.  The rooms are very well maintained and have a nice suite set up.  The total square footage is not unusually large, but it feels very homey & comfortable.  They also have refrigerators with a digital thermostat - a big plus for me.  My only complaint is that there's a $12.95 per day internet charge, but

my two friends and I stayed for one impromptu night. Courtney at the front desk was amazing! she was friendly and professional. our stay would not have been made possible if it weren't for her above-and-beyond attitude. Marriott needs more employees like her. our room had a king bed in a separate room, a queen pullout and a queen murphy bed in the living room. the room had a nice balcony off the living room overlooking the back bay. we were on the 8th floor and didn't hear anyone above us, or next to us. the pool and Jacuzzi were open late which was nice, and there are nice fire pits around the pool area. the bartender seemed overwhelmed in the evening with the amount of people there, but she was still friendly and prompt. there isn't much around the hotel unless you are in the

have stayed in this hotel multiple times before . like to suite size with hall and bedroom making it comfortable for official visits . my room did not have a soap when i checked in and i had to wait almost 20 mins for a running sweating service person to give it to me after second call . looks like this hotel likes to really run on lean staff . otherwise location and everything else was fine .breakfast at 19$ could have had more options in my opinion like pancakes/waffles etc
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. Marriott has just changed our bathroom amenities to a new great product line. Included in the change is a shower gel. We still offer a bar soap on the vanity for guests. My apologies for the delay in you receiving the additional bar of soap. For the breakfast buffet we do offer waffles and pancakes but we may need to improve our signage. I will; make sure that we implement a better process.  Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: Large suites, good value for the money
Summary: I just stayed two nights at this hotel. I am not much of a "Marriott" type of person. I tend to find them consistent (which I like) but extremely, extremely boring.   They have hotels everywhere in the USA, so it is very convenient for work trips.   Re this hotel: + rooms are very spacious and nice. all rooms are suites, with bathtub and shower. the best of the hotel experience. +good price/quality ratio +/- location: not sure familiar with the area but it is a weird location, in the middle of office complexes. very close to the airport, which it was convenient for me. rent a car, if not you feel completely stranded. +/- room service food was average -no airport shuttle. also, i almost missed my flight. it took 45' MINUTES for the taxi to arrive. reception told me, you only need
Manager Response: My sincerer apologies for the taxi service and the room service food. We are working with our taxi companies to have a consistent call time so that our guests are not delayed. Our room service menu has recently been updated and I'm sure that your experience was a onetime event. Our hotel information is located on channel 30 rather than in a directory book. We hope that on your next visit to Newport Beach you will try us again.  Thank you, John

Summary: I was very impressed with this hotel. The exterior and public areas were well maintained.The views of the bay from the suite are beautiful.The room was nice and very comfortable The room was tastefully decorated. The staff are very professional and courteous. This is also an excellent location,close to SNA,shopping,business areas. It is a short drive to the beaches. I highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed here just one night and found it to be OK.  The rooms are two room suites, which is great.  The bayview room we had really did not have much of a bayview after all.  The location need the Back Bay is great for running and walking.  The restaurant had a nice breakfast buffet ($19 per person) and room service was satisfactory.  We had some issues checking in as the room we were given was not fully cleaned when we entered for the first time...and the housekeeping staff entered with a master key after we had unpacked, which was a bit unsettling.  They offered to move us and gave us a comp fruit tray (I'm a g Gold Elite Marriott cardholder) which was appreciated.  So, the hotel gets an A for those efforts.    It is not a destination resort by any means but it is
Manager Response: I wanted to write back to you regarding your room that was not completely clean. This is unacceptable for you to have been checked into a room that is not perfect. Our housekeeping team takes pride ensuring that every guest has a perfect room. You should have never been checked into this room until it was perfect. I hope that you will give us another chance to show you how Brilliant we can be.  Sincerely, John

Summary: 2 Nights stay, king room on 6th floor overlooking bay and pool, great view. This is an all-suites property and I just loved the layout of the room and condition on the entire hotel. Beds were so comfy!  The staff were all SO NICE and so very helpful, made use feel like we were family. Breakfast was included and it was perfect. A great selection of hot and cold foods were offered and presented perfectly.  Pool and gym both looked inviting but didn't use either, clean and all the gear you would need.  No lounge but mini fridge and breakfast made up for all that.  Can't say enough good things about this place, will no doubt be back!

We decided to stay here from reading the reviews from Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed.  All the rooms are suites.  The bathroom was large.  The french doors separating the living room and the bedroom make it look like a home.  The view to the bay and the pool was all worth it.  The breakfast was excellent.  the staff was soo friendly.  if you ask the chef nicely, you could get other items not given on the buffet.  The indoor-outdoor pool with spa was excellent.  it was so quiet and nice.    if i have the chance, i would stay here again

I stayed at this Marriott on Bayview this past week for business.  The staff was great- always greeting and asking if I needed anything. Every morning I asked them to call me a cab to travel  to the client site. When the cab was running late one morning the staff asked me repeatedly if they could buy me coffee while they followed up as to why the cab hadn't arrived yet. Then when I was finally in the taxi and en route, the staff called the driver and said they would pay the fare. I appreciate them going out of their way.

My family stayed at Newport Beach Marriott last weekend. We had a wonderful time. The staff was wonderful. Our suite on the 6th floor was great. The suite was large, our bed was really comfortable, the bathroom was huge and shower wonderful. We had a delicious breakfast at the restaurant and lunch outside by the pool. Both meals were delicious. Every staff member we ran into were kind and helpful. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

Used my Marriott Points for a little getaway to escape the heat and relax this past weekend and was so pleased with everything! The staff was incredibly nice, the room was perfect! I love the french doors leading into the bedroom....really a nice touch to the very spacious suite.  The location is great, fast and easy to get to the heart of Newport for dinner or shopping. Request a room with a bay view....its worth it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The hotel was new, modern, and well kept.  The front desk was very efficient and helpful.  They helped me with dinner reservations for the 2 nights I was there.  They were like "London" good if you've been to London.  They worry about you like a big brother.  Breakfast was excellent.  The omelet chef was the best I've seen in 40 years of traveling.  He know how to melt the cheese on the outside of the omelet (very fancy).  The rooms were all suites.  Plenty of room and there were both wired and wireless internet connections.  Bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows.  Parking was $21/day.  I'm not sure I would go across the street for cheaper parking.  There were very few cars in the garage across the street and I would guess that would make what cars are there a good target

I have been coming here for 3 years for business travel. I stay here on average 3-4 times a year. The rooms are al suites with a big living room and a seperate bedroom. The couch pulls out into a bed so you can easily sleep 4 adults in a room. They have a restaruant onsite and a great buffet breakfast every morning. The breakfast is free for Gold and Platinum members. They just updated the room service menu in the past 3-4 months (at least it seems that way since i dont recall most of the new items) and its really good. I had been getting tired of the same menu :) I have to say, I just had the street fish tacos and the grilled cheese sliders with tomato fondu, i kid you not both were excellent. Everyone is always friendly and its good to see some friendly faces (I see Kavon
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments. We did just update our menus in the restaurant and room service. We have had many compliments on the new menus.  I will make sure that Kavon gets your feedback as well. He is a wonderful server and we are very lucky to have him.  Sincerely, John

Summary: Recent business trip. Great hotel, huge rooms, really comfortable beds. Location not ideal without a car but great for both business & pleasure. Expensive to get to & from LAX by taxi >$100 one way. Would stay again but would make sure I had a hire car for convenience

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, but no concierge lounge
Summary: Second time staying at this property and if you are Platinum, your status does not matter at hotel.  The hotel did not have valet, no bellman for your bags, and no concierge lounge.  Parking is $21 a day and you can park across street for $15 a day. The best part of the hotel is not at the hotel, but across the street.  The Upper Newport Preserve is walking distance with very nice trails. Had a strange situation where housekeeping moved all my toiletries from one part of the sink to the other part of the sink for some unknown reason.  I had all my original items nicely laid out on a washcloth.  I don't like other people touching my toothbrush, vitamins, hairbrush, etc.  It is not appropriate to tamper with a quests items.
Manager Response: I wanted to write back to you regarding your stay. You are correct that we don't offer a valet service but we do have bell service for guest that requests it. We also don’t have a private concierge for our Marriott reward members but we do offer all Gold and Platinum members a complimentary breakfast in our restaurant 7 days a week. We also try to upgrade our platinum guests to a premium room when available. Regarding you toiletries being move I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. Our housekeepers do organize guest’s toiletries laying them on a clean towel. I hope the next time your travels bring you to Newport Beach you will give us another try. Sincerely, John

Summary: From a European perspective the style of the hotel is a bit ancient but everything is clean and faultless. But the hotel has a bar, a restaurant, a small pool, friendly staff, rooms with a good size and reasonable value for money. It’s nicely located at the Upper Newport Bay Nature Preserve, so perfect for a walk or running. Unfortunately the location is pretty remote so you definitely need a car or cab to see something else, since the immediate area doesn’t provide any attractions in walking distance.

I stayed here only for one night thinking it was the other Marriott Spa Hotel near the mall. The lobby has a small bar and the pool area was small as well. This hotel is really not in Newport Beach and it does not face a bay! This hotel is closer to John Wayne Airport and the main Fwy's.off Jamborree Rd. The water shed is a runoff not close to the ocean. The rooms are comfortable suites and the beds are simply divine, typical of Marriott. The breakfast buffet is scrumptuous and free if you are Gold Marriott member or above.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry that you were not happy with your view and that our location didn’t fit your needs. Over 50% of our rooms have a bay view. Although it is good to see that you did enjoy your room and bed.  Sincerely, John

Summary: The Newport Beach Marriott Bayview has all of features of a big luxury hotel and the intimacy of a small boutique hotel.  The staff is helpful, warm and friendly.  The accommodations are lovely.  The bed is comfortable and the rooms are very clean.  Whether it's a business trip, family vacation or a weekend getaway for just the two of you, I highly recommend this hotel.   My husband and I have stayed there twice and will surely use it as a home base when we need another get away weekend.

Summary Heading: Nice leisure stay in a well kept business-traveler focused hotel
Summary: You can tell the hotel mainly caters to business travelers but made for a nice leisure stay.  Rate we paid was reasonable for quality/location.  Only complaint is that it would have been nice if the pool was slightly larger, but it was still ok size and enjoyable.  Room was clean and well maintained. Short 20 minute drive to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments. I'm sorry that the pool area was not sufficient for your need. We focus on not only the business traveler but with guests with families. I hope the next time your plans bring you to Orange County you will stay with us again.  Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: Will definitely come back and refer to everyone traveling to area.
Summary: Great location.  Great service. Clean rooms. Beautiful property.  Did I mention the location was amazing?! So close to fashion island.  So close to beach.  So close to balboa island. So close to pacific coast highway.

Summary Heading: Excellent Marriot in a very nice area
Summary: Recently stayed here for business and would return for pleasure.  I was given a suite which was very large and overlooked the water.  The hotel common grouds are well kept and attractive.  The general area is quite upscale with lots of cafes, etc.  Pool is small but quite nice.  Overall one of the nicest Marriotts I have stayed in.  Enjoy!

Summary Heading: Great Location for going anywhere in LA and OC
Summary: There are not a lot of Marriott properties in this area and to qualify myself, I am a Platinum Marriott  member. This location is right off of Jamboree and puts you in a very good location to go into LA or down south or to the beach or a quit run to Fashion Island.  OK. I was staying here to spend a night to meet an old friend and his wife.  The entrance is grand and the social area and bar are in a strategic location for meeting and greeting.  The outside area with seating and gas fires are great for lounging and catching up. Pretty view and not crowded.  Our room was a one bedroom suite and I was very pleased with the size and the layout.  The bathroom was huge and there was plenty of space to host an additional couple if needed.  The only thing that I could have issue with is

Thanks to the advice of other trip advisor reviews, I booked this hotel.  Pros: Quiet All Suite-lots of room, all non-smoking Right by nature reserve Great service free coffee and wifi in lobby balcony  Cons: Paid parking and paid internet smaller pool Not many restaurants or things to do w/in walking distance expensive restaurant awkward 2 door bathroom  Overall good for a business hotel. Very low key and quiet. I would stay here again if I needed to be in this area.

Stayed for two nights the rooms where large with a nice little  living room area with a good work space.  Rooms are clean with a large bathroom.  We had a bay view but not much to look at since it is not much of a bay.  There are closer places to the water.  But if you have business near by its perfect

Summary Heading: Not on the beach, but a good location
Summary: We have stayed previously at the Marriott Newport Coast villas timeshare resort and were blown away by the location and the beautiful pools and other amenities.  This time we were here for a baseball trip and needed a bit different location.  I would say uneven best describes this hotel.  There were times the service was amazing.  We had breakfast included and the wait staff in the dining room was great.  We were always seated promptly and they were constantly there to refill water, drinks, etc.  Also I was out by the pool one day (which is very small if that interests you) and I had to go in to find a waiter.  But once I did he couldn't have been more helpful.  Brought our drinks out immediately, came with our order and didn't complain when others in our party came late and
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on our hotel. I will definitely pass your comments on to the restaurant team. Regarding the housekeeping issues and getting your room cleaned during your stay I have discussed this concern with the housekeeping team and rectified the problem for future stays.

Summary: We are a family of 2 adults/2 kids and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a week long trip visiting the Southern California coast.  The hotel is very nice and more of an upscale hotel catering to business clientele.  The room was a spacious suite containing one room with a king bed, a large sofa couch in the living room with another tv, a desk and chair and a counter with fridge.  There was a balcony, but there were no chairs to sit outside.  The bathroom had a separate shower, a bath tub and a small counter area with sink.  There was also a closet in the bathroom rather than in the bedroom.  The room was spotless as was the bathroom.  The furniture was also in very good shape and the decor was nice.  One thing we did notice was that the rooms did not contain a safe.  We

After many years at the nearby Irvine Marriott, I decided to try this nearby hotel . . . and will be back.  I would describe the atmosphere as laid back.  The hotel is in a quiet area and, even if busy, the lobby etc. are quiet.  Check-in was quick and the front desk folks were very pleasant.  Elevators are quick, even though there are only two for a large hotel.  Had a standard room (no view).  The living room is spacious -- huge for one and more than large enough for two.  Separate bedroom.  Bed wasn't the most comfortable I've had in the Marriott chain but it was ok.  Big TV in living room and good-sized TV in bedroom.  Separate desk/working area in the living room.  There is a dressing area with two sinks and a separate (and large) bath with separate tub and shower.  Decor

We stayed three nights on a complimentary business event. The hotel staff were very friendly and the hotel was located right across from Fashion Island which was particularly nice for when we had some free time. How the hotel managed this business event was exceptional. In terms of service this hotel knows what it was doing. Our rooms were quite a walk from the lobby and honestly I did expect a little bit more from the Marriott in terms of their rooms but generally it was quite nice.

We stayed two nights in this beautiful hotel. The staff was very friendly and when we checked in they even added complimentary breakfast wish was a nice surprise.  The rooms are very clean, spacious, and comfortable.  We enjoyed the pool and the lobby is nice and bright.  Parking lot is also spacious and right in front of the hotel with only a short walk to the lobby. Great location and close by to a lot of restaurants and the beach.

It may not be what everybody wants, but for us this hotel was perfect. Plenty of space for self parking although no valet, a small fridge but no mini bar, and the best part is that all the rooms are suites; real suites, not the so called "suites" that are really just one room with a couch. The bedroom is not huge but it is separated from a good size living room, with a desk, couch and chair. The bathroom has 3 doors, one to the bedroom, one to the sink area and closet, and one to the shower and bathtub; extremely well planned specially if there are guests sleeping in the  living room. I did find that there was very little counter space around the sink area, however; no room to put much down. Each room has it own tv and there is a balcony off the living room. The breakfast was

Summary Heading: Great Option in Pricey Newport Beach
Summary: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It's very clean, in the rooms and in the lobby. The standard rooms are almost 100 sq feet bigger than the other Newport Beach Marriott which is about 2 miles down the road and the price is about $40-50 cheaper too! Each room has a separate living area with a couch, desk and TV area which leads out to a balcony. There is a large bar top area with a coffee maker and mini fridge. There is a separate tub and separate shower. The sink is in an area where you can close it off from the toilet/shower area and the bedroom, allowing for great privacy especially if you were traveling with a friend or co-worker. The bathroom area is actually quite large. I've stayed in "suites" in more expensive hotels with less sq footage than this room!   I found all

I stayed at the Newport Beach Marriott for a week with my son who was taking a course at UC Irvine. When we checked in on Saturday morning the clerk informed us, in a very friendly way, that breakfast was included in our rate. This was news to me, but I was pleasantly surprised. Breakfast is expensive! $15-$20 / person. However, to make sure, I checked with the clerk on our way to breakfast on Sunday morning. The clerk looked it up. Yes it was included.   Then of course when we checked the following Saturday, one week later, there were our breakfasts (except for the first 3 days) on the bill. Over $135.00 extra. The clerk called the manager. I guess he was the night manager -- it was 6 in the morning. Ah yes, he said, I can see how the clerks misread the code. You had a B9 code,
Manager Response: I wanted to follow up with your comments and sincerely apologize for your experience at the hotel. Unfortunately breakfast is not included with your stay but we do offer packages that do. The miss communication that was told to you was a mistake and I hope that you understand. We are also reviewing our current breakfast program and discussing different and healthier items in the future.  I hope that you next trip to Newport Beach that you will give us an opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely, John

Summary: Recently stayed at this hotel, was very nice and clean. Central location is recommendable, however some things, such as parking, are pricey. (free refreshments are on offer in the lobby however) As it mostly caters to people on business (convention center etc.) the hotel is quiet in the evenings. Considering the price and its location, it offers exactly what one may expect, no more no less.

For a four star hotel, i expected less and i am happy that it exceeded my expectations.   The service was great, staff were all warm and helpful. The lobby had free wifi, cozy and nice.  The breakfast buffet had great selections and nicely situated area with the pool view.  The rooms were neat, clean, spacious and complete.  The bed was very comfortable, sheets and pillows looked new.  The towels though need to changed-kinda overused.  I didnt expect much from the toiletries since its not a five star, it's pretty good for the rating of the hotel.  I must say, it was a good stay and not bad!

Summary Heading: $21.00 to park your car is ridiculus
Summary: $21.00 to park your car is ridiculous... otherwise nice hotel.. $21.00 bucks to park your car.. Really?? 21 big ones... killing me.. parking should be free unless valet.. Parking space was very nice however.. Very clean.. Well kept.. Lines were freshly painted..

This is a superb hotel in my opinion. I have stayed at many Marriott" s throughout the globe over the years but, this is certainly one of their finer properties. Its location is a can't miss, it is near John Wayne Airport, shopping, beaches, etc. The exterior of the hotel was so well manicured. The lobby area  was incredibly well maintained. The rooms were excellent. Spacious, clean and so comfortable with a great view. The staff was so friendly and courteous. I truly look forward to another visit at this outstanding hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay for business
Summary: I've stayed at this Marriott on numerous occasions on business.  It has a comfortable bar area, beautiful outdoor sitting area and patio for relaxing after spending long days in meetings.
