It's not within walking distance from anything in particular, but certainly quiet, clean, and everything you would expect from a smaller Marriott.  I suppose the only amenity it lacks is a concierge lounge; however, a free breakfast buffet more than makes up for that.  I try to stay there whenever I'm in the area.

I had a wonderful stay at this lovely hotel this weekend.  It exceeded my expectations, and that is quite an accomplishment.  As a Platinum Member of the Marriott Rewards program and due to frequent business travel, I stat at Marriott hotels very often. The Newport Beach Bayview ranks among the top experiences.  We had a flawless 2 night visit.  The suite was beautiful and comfortable.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  The staff was friendly, competent, helpful, and courteous.  The food from room service and in the restaurant was superbly prepared and delicious, and the staff attentive.  We had a room on the 9th floor with a nice view of the bay.  Although the John Wayne Airport is nearby (which is convenient if you have to fly in and you can avoid LAX), I did not hear

Summary Heading: Tranquility 5 Minutes From John Wayne Airport
Summary: Stayed at this hotel a few nights in May, 2013. Hotel is five minutes from John Wayne Airport (Orange County). Situated on the bank of an tidal estuary the hotel offers lovely views of the water. The pool and nearby gazebo are adjacent to a fountain and manicured green space. Saw some hummingbirds zipping about. Adirondack chairs provide a placid vantage point. Reception was efficient at check in, even though we arrived before noon. Parking costs $21/day, which made me sad, but all the hotels in the area charge for parking. My room was very comfortable. I did not have views of the water, but the comfortable bed made up for it. Internet service was solid (wireless and wired) in the room and in the lobby. A respectable breakfast buffet is offered mornings. One may order off a menu

I'm really glad I chose this hotel.  The suite was really comfortable and set up well.  The staff was great.  The seating and pool areas had enough of a 'resort feel' that it didn't feel like a stuffy business hotel at all.  Parking and drinks are pricey though....  But room service was good.    The location was nice.  I was afraid it would feel like the hotel was in an 'industrial area'.  But it didn't at all.  You definitely want a car if you're staying here though to see the sights and enjoy the restaurants and shopping in the area.  It's a quick and easy drive to SNA airport, too.  I would stay here again if I got a good rate!
Manager Response: Thank you for you kind word. We would love to have you back again in the future. Thank You, John

Summary: This was a weekend get away to the Newport Area for Mother's Day. The hotel is not so attractive from the outside, but looks great on the inside. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Rooms are all Suites and spacious. Bathroom set up is a problem! There is no privacy if you have to share the bathroom. There is a sliding door that leads to the bedroom and another door that has a lock. A person can enter through the sliding door and find you in the toilet doing your "Business ", which my son found me doing. If this was a co-worker sharing a room, it would have been humiliating. This is seriously a problem. There is no other closure to the bathroom, if you enter through the sliding door. Also, the shower faces the toilet. So again, it is very inconvenient to have someone shower
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We are very sorry about all the inconveniences during your stay with the bathroom. We hope the next time you are visiting the Newport area that you will try us again.  John

Summary: I loved this hotel. The location was excellent. The hotel was very nice and clean. All the staff there was very friendly and helpful. I love the weather here in California and I would definitely recommend staying here if you are planning a trip to Newport beach California.
Manager Response: Thank you for you comments! We look forward to your next trip to Newport Beach! John

Summary: Great location. We spent 1 night and we were very satisfied! Purchased the complimentary breakfast and parking package, definately the way to go, as others have mentioned, parking is $21 a night. We had a corner room on the 8th floor. Staff was very friendly. Would definately return if in the area again.
Manager Response: Thank you both for the wonderful comments. We offer some great packages that include parking and internet. Many with breakfast as well.  You can find them on Marriott.com We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely, John

Summary: Just returned from a two night stay at this property. I just wanted to thank all the excellent kind staff at this location who really looked after myself and my pet during the stay.  Definitely a pet friendly property.  Very pleasant stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderfull feedback!  Sincerely, John

Summary: I stayed here because it was the location of a conference I attended. The room was beautiful, clean, spacious and quiet. There is a modest restaurant and cocktail bar.  On the down side, you pay for parking, internet, and there is no shuttle. It's a 4.5 mile trip to the nearest mall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments! We do offer free Wi-Fi in our lobby. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely, John

Summary Heading: Beautiful rooms, but caveat emptor about the location.
Summary: Nothing within an easy walk for entertainment.  Taxi svs is excellent, but pricey.  10-15$  to go grocery shopping or to mall shopping.  The hotel does have a pool, Starbucks coffee and a nice restaurant and we received polite, A-list service.  Internet is free Wi-Fi in lobby, 12.95$ additional/day.  Caveat Emptor.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback! We hope to have you back again soon.  Sincerely, John

Summary: Our bay view suite was spacious and clean and a bargain at $189.  The staff at the desk were warm and welcoming- not only gave us a short bottle of complimentary California wine, but a wine opener when we brought our own bottle the next night.  There is a microwave on each floor.  Just outside the back door is a  walk around the back bay, a muddy tidal area and bird sanctuary.  We saw traffic stop on the six lane boulevard, Jamboree, to allow a mother duck to escort her wee waddlers across the lanes to safety.   Don't waste your money upgrading for the breakfast. It was an all time low. The omelet chef at the buffet dropped one of our orders and it took so long for him to catch up the others were cold. That was day one. Day two my omelet was so full of onions it was not edible.
Manager Response: I wanted to thank you for your feedback. I was pleased to hear that you enjoyed the room and the Back Bay. Regarding the breakfast I wanted to apologize for your experience in the restaurant. You can be assured that I have discussed this issue with the chef and restaurant manager so that going forward all of our guests will see an improvement is our service. Sincerely, John

Summary: No complaints really. Staff polite and attentive. Excellent location, with Fashion Island just on its door step. Personally I pref South Coast Plaza shopping mall, which is bigger and has more mainstream shops on offer. A quick taxi ride away. Lots of good restaurants also with the Fashion Island area. The food was pretty good. I was lucky to get a room in the new block, on the 16th floor. Think this is supposed to be better from what I was told. Great ocean view and view of golf course. Only one slight wrinkle. The hotel is regularly booked out with events in its ballrooms and function rooms, so the hotel feels very busy on the lobby level. As a result creates an image of a standard corporate hotel with people passing through and not a relaxed, exclusive feel to it. I am sure

My family (4 of us) stayed at the Marriott Bayview for a week during spring break. We stayed there a year ago for just one night and decided that it would be a great place to try again. We made a great decision to stay there again. The room layout was perfect for us. We had a room with a murphy bed and a fold-out couch. The bathroom layout is also great with pocket doors to section off the bathroom. We also loved that it has a separate shower and tub. We used the mini-frig to keep a gallon of milk for cereal in the morning. The king bed was very comfortable and we liked having a window that opened in the bedroom. The balcony is nice too. We used the pool and jacuzzi a few times and it was great after spending the day at the beach. The workout room is very nice with great
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on our hotel. We are very proud of our hotel and feel it's a great option for families. We do charge for internet but in the entire lobby public space the internet is free. Also regarding the smoking we have improved our signage around the hotel and making it easier for guest who want to smoke find the location that doesn’t effect our other guests. Thanks again for your comments and I will pass it on to the staff.  Sincerely, John

Summary: The check in was slow and painful..they could not find my reservation. However they gave me a good deal..the rooms are nice and big..like a mini suite. The parking entry was broken and breakfast was late but free. Get a package rate. I might return.

Perfect location fro shopping and beaches. Close to Fashion Island Shopping Mall, short, quick drive to Laguna Beach, Newport Beach or Huntington Beach. All beach areas have quaint, unique shops worth perusing.

I travel here 2x per month as my company is headquartered a 1/2 mile away.  I have travelled for work for my career and have been a loyal Marriott Gold/Platinum member.  The property was okay, middle of the road but I've noticed many Marriotts have been like this for the last year.  I think the property was okay, satisfied my needs but they don't go out of their way.  Understaffed at front desk and at night in bar/restaurant area.  Overstaffed at breakfast. I will stay here again since it's convenient to work, hopefully they will tweak it and it will improve.

Stayed at this property a few times but, have not ever reviewed this hotel. This Marriott is a beautiful all-suite hotel. The sitting area offers a nice living room style feeling while, a separate tub and shower allow for more than one person to prepare for the day. The little details make all the difference - lovely boxed in-room coffee and tea, pocket door to separate the bathroom and bedroom, extra comfy beds, two flat screen TVs, a great desk in the living area and a balcony. Weekend deals can be fantastic but, otherwise, expect Marriott rates, to pay for parking and to pay for the internet (all normal at most all Marriotts). Very close to Fashion Island. Nice walks at the bay right across the street.  Starbucks in the lobby area too!

No bellman in a marriot in a nice area of Southern California was odd. There were bell carts just sitting in the hallways because after a guest uses it, they leave it and no one comes to pick it up.   Lots of room service trays in the hallway.   Breakfast is a free for all joke. It's a buffet but they will cook you food to order but there is no line and is completely unorganized. The food was gross.  Had to continually ask our server for coffee and water refills. Then we asked for the check, she was sure to tell us, "gratuity is NOT included." I tip a server to get the food and expo it from the kitchen. I am the one who had to do that though? I had to ask again and again for the only thing you serve, water and coffee! So what am I tipping you for?  Good luck taking a shower. The

Relaxing weekend.  Check in was painless.  Received a room with the view of the bay and over looking the pool.  Nice grounds. Very tropical.  Room was spacious and clean with a small balcony.  Very comfortable bed.  However, the sofa bed blanket needed to be cleaned.  It was good to have HDTV’s in the living room and bedroom. However, at times the signal was not all that and most of the channels were not coming in as HD. Small fridge was a plus to keep our waters cool.  Enjoyed the teas too in the room.  There was ample parking.  Lobby was nice.  Enjoyed the free flavored waters in the lobby.  There was wired internet in the rooms.  However, would have liked to have had free wifi instead.  Breakfast crew was very courteous.  Cook to order omelet bar was good.  Pool was very

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with Little or No Service
Summary: I could go one and on about all the small incidents which made me write that as the opening title.  From the moment I drove it feels as though the property is run by people who have never been in the hospitality industry and the service is what I would expect at a small inn in the middle of nowhere.  Personally I feel there is room to hire more staff to accommodate the guests. There is only self parking yet you have to pay $21 a night for it.  There are no bellman.  When I drove up to unload, I walked it to the front desk to ask for a cart and a woman had to retrieve one.  It was finally delivered a few minutes later as though it had been a nuisance that I had asked.     As I checked in there was a card for Elite Members welcoming you with your choice of a welcome "gift"

Summary Heading: nice room, nice view, great omelette
Summary: our room overlooking the back bay was very nice, clean, modern and featured a separate sitting room area. the staff were very nice, very welcoming and eager to help with all those getting settled issues that come up at arrival. we had a drink in the bar and the service was wonderful. for breakfast (included) we tried out their famous omelette. i asked for a small omelette with everything. javier didn't miss a beat. he fixed me the best omelette i've ever had, just the right size and perfect with their fresh salsa.  we were on a short stay, but we would recommend this hotel to friends/family any time. and when we need another night away, this place will be on the list.

Serene is the perfect way to describe this hotel. From the lounge area to the poolside, to the gazebo, and the large suites with panoramic views of the Back Bay, the Newport Marriott Bayview is lovely in every aspect. My only complaint is the added fees for parking and internet. Honestly, they'd be better off just charging more per night than making us feel like every "luxury" has an added fee. Love this place for the beauty, not the value.

Summary Heading: Well maintained property.  Excellent value for the area
Summary: This hotel was well maintained and in a very good location.  The room I had was a 2-room suite with a large bathroom.  It was clean, modern and in excellent condition as was the rest of this property.  Although there is no concierge lounge, they do offer a voucher for breakfast in the restaurant.  There are not really great views from this hotel.  Although we had a "bay view" room, the view was nothing to write home about.  I found the customer service excellent.

My husband was travelling for work and I tagged along. My husband is a Platinum member for Marriott. We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights (2/21/13 to 2/24/13). I had made a reservation for bay-view, King suit for us.  Here are the bullets: Wrong type room assigned No one answer the call, unless you go to the reception desk Accident in the bathroom Breakfast mess up by the chef  Details:  We reached and the receptionist verified all the info, confirmed the room we had reserved and gave us the key. We reached to the room and to our surprised, they had assigned us a parking lot view (opposite to bayview) room. The girl in the reception DID NOT even bother to tell us while checking in. I called and they said they have no room available that we reserved but a handicap

I had a great experience during my stay here. Clean and comfortable rooms and awesome food at the hotel restaurant. Staff was excellent, friendly, and willing to help you. No free internet (very expensive, BTW); parking is also charged to your room. Staff is very friendly. Pool area is OK, Hotel has a Starbucks inside the lobby. I recommend.

Had a pleasant 1night stay. Breakfast and over night self-parking were an unexpected $20 each. Staff were friendly. Rooms were clean. it was quiet and the sunset over the bay was beautiful.  It was a short trip to Fashion Island for dinner.

I like this property. It is quiet. Great location. Staff is friendly. They have the suites so the rooms are larger. The fitness center is nice and you are right next to the Back Bay if you want to walk/jog. The breakfast is good, as well. They have the pool that is partially inside/outside and outdoor pool area is nice.

Summary Heading: What you expect from a Marriott
Summary: Left hotel today.. Great stay, even though the power went out wed night. On thursday morning there was a lady at the door apologizing for the outage, which didnt last long anyway. Nice touch that many, many hotels would never think to do.   What sets this place apart is that you really feel welcome. Frequent greetings, goodmornings, good evenings, from staff. Lots of smiles. The message they send is that ..... Im glad i work here, im glad youre here,  and i want you to let me help you. Opposite of the costa mesa marriott, which clearly sends the message that customers are annoying.   One complaint... Water in shower does not get hot. Im sure this is some california greenies idea of helping the environment and saving energy. But i dont know that so i run the  shower 15 minutes

For a decent price My daughters and stayed at this wonderful hotel.We had tons of room and the pool was fantastic.We had plenty to do in the area but mainly stayed in because it was such a nice place.Ordered room service and recieved more then enough good quality food.

Summary Heading: Nice Marriott would stay here again for sure!
Summary: Excellent breakfast buffet. Nice rooms, beautiful grounds, and a nice front desk. Newprt Beach is fabulous. We will be back. We had a small suite with a shower and bathtub. The furniture was plush and newer,

I have stayed at this hotel at least 20 times over the last 3 years. It is an excellent traveling home/office. I appreciate the extra room that each suite offers. It has all the bells and whistles that a business traveler would want, comfortable bed, quiet heating/cooling, nice shower, ample outlets for electronics, multiple TV's, etc. It is situated on an inland bay and has nice jogging/biking trails for a workout. The workout room has been updated as well. This hotel dos not have the lounge that elite Marriott guests use but makes up for it by putting free water in the room and offers a free breakfast for elites. I think the best thing about this hotel is the customer service. The staff is unfailingly polite and professional. They are well trained.

Summary Heading: Hotel Overcharged My Credit Card and Refuses to Refund
Summary: I stayed in this hotel in November and the hotel over billed my credit card.  Multiple calls to the manager and accounting department have produced no returned calls.  Absolutely incredible that a Marriott affiliated property would be operating this way. A big ZERO stars.

Summary Heading: Pubic hair on bathroom floor, and a $250 smoking charge when I don't smoke which management refused to address, terrible place s
Summary: Pubic hair on bathroom floor, and a $250 smoking charge when I don't smoke which management refused to address, terrible place stay away. Ok hotel although dated unless you expect cleaned bathrooms or for the hotel not to steal from you.

But I read another review that said there was another pool? I have no idea where?! The pool is nice sized and also rather indoor/outdoor so has lots of shade and lounge chairs. In fact, between the lobby and the outside area, one had plenty of comfortable places to sit outside of the room. I wish they would have a massuese ongrounds as I had to go over to the Newport marriott who's layout is not as easy to navigate between spa and pool.  I agree tho with not paying the extra for "bayview" as it's not that impressive.  The only complaints I really had was it was a warm night and the AC blows right on the bed all night, so I was either hot or cold plus it gave me a bad sinus headache. And the pillows went flat so I did NOT have a good night of sleep:( Just wish I had known one

Summary Heading: Very clean and pleasant but there are additional costs.
Summary: Pluses:  Large clean rooms.  Pleasant staff and nice grounds. Minuses: $21 parking charge per night.  $13 WiFi charge per night in the room.  Free WiFi in the lobby.  Around $15 charge for a not very good breakfast.  We held a school reunion at the this Marriott Hotel in Newport Beach, CA.  I do recommend this hotel but be prepared to pay a lot more than the room charge.

This is a great looking hotel on the outside.  Once inside, it has a few warts.  Like noisey air conditioning in the room, and dinner that is better eaten at an off-premise steakhouse.  And, the $21 per night parking is a real wallet-teaser.  Perhaps what really irked me the most was the lack of customer service when I would call.  I had people just switch me to the national Marriott reservations line before I could even say what I needed.  Or, one of their fine staff who 3 times promised to return my call, but never did - a few years ago, this would not have been accepted by Marriott Hotels, but I guess times change and the Marriott brand label now includes tolerance for sloppy maintenance, less-than-premium restaurants, and broken promises.  So, it rates a average review, and

Summary Heading: Great view, great rooms, ok service
Summary: This is a great place to get away for a night,  the property used to be called a Marriott Suites and it still retains the suite room layout.  The weekend rates are usually a good value, except for the insanely high parking charge.  If your willing to walk a block you can park for free on the street down on Bayview Way.  The pool is great and the outdoor fire pit is a great place to end a romantic evening.  That's the good, now the bad.  Overall Marriott's standard customer care is well below par here.  If you are looking for over the top service or care, move on up the road to Newport Beach Marriott.  I stay here a couple of times a year and the value makes up for the service.

This is part two of Good Value...Sunrise Redondo BW.  It was like a breathe of fresh air after the Sunrise BW Redondo.  We stayed in this area before. Close to freeway, malls, good restaurants as well an easy drive to Fashion Mall and Balboa Island. All and all a good neighborhood.  Check-in was seamless and welcoming. The lobby and room are well appointed, more of what we were looking for.  Our room was a one bedroom (fourth floor road side, quiet) with a pullout and Murphy bed. Good size bathroom with tub and separate shower. Plus plenty of closet space for luggage etc. A mini fridge and coffee maker as well complimented the room.  Pool area was a hit, hot tub was hot. Workout area and gear are current. Ordering poolside was good and not as expensive as I thought. I recommend

Summary Heading: Good quality rooms, great service....perfect for birdwatchers!
Summary: If you are a birdwatcher, being able to walk from the hotel to top quality lagoon birdwatching makes this a wonderful place to stay. Add to that the hummingbirds and finches which bathe in the patio fountain! For everyone - this is a high-end Marriott, convenient to Irvine and the John Wayne airport. Good food, bar area and nicely spacious rooms. All the staff extremely helpful.

I just spent the weekend at Newport Beach Bayview and was treated very well and the staff was courteous and professional from the time we checked in.  The employee that checked us in Connor was very welcoming and upbeat. We requested a late checkout because our next stop was the Newport Coast Villas and our room wasn't going to be ready until later that afternoon.  He approved the request and we were able to bridge our time between both resorts.   The first night we had dinner at the bar because we were jet lagged and didn't feel like venturing out. The female bartender was friendly and recommended a couple of entrees that were right on!! Very pleased with the staff and immenities at the resort and would definitely return for another stay.

Stayed there for three nights recently.  It's a nice property with spacious rooms, but I was not pleased sharing my space with dogs.  After having a conversation with management, I was informed that pets were not allowed above the 5th floor or in lounges & resturants.  Unfortunately this policy is not inforced.  I will probably choose another Marriott when I return to the area.

My Uncle came in town and wanted a place where her could enjoy golf, the beach and visit relatives. He was so please with his room. it had a view of the Back-bay and a separate living room to entertain. The staff was most helpful with directions and he enjoyed his golf game which was less then ten minutes away.  We ate at the hotel one night and the food was delicious.

Summary Heading: Nice stay at Newport Marriott Bayview
Summary: Stayed here for two nights while visiting friends in OC with my wife before transitioning to the Burbank Marriott for week long business trip. As a loyal Marriott Elite member, I debated about staying here or at the Newport Beach Marriott and Spa which is a couple of miles closer to the beach. But after comparing all of the reviews of both hotels on tripadvisor, I decided to stay here at the Marriott Bayview.  As others have said, this is not a typical Marriott hotel. All of the rooms are suites so the only option in room choices is whether you want a bay view or not. I wouldn't pay extra for one, the view isn't all that impressive compared to a non bay view room. Probably the only other noticeable difference between this and a typical full service Marriott is that there's no

Our family stayed here for just one night before we checked into the Marriott Newport Coast Villas and to check it out for future stays. We thought it was a great hotel and we really liked our room, which was a small suite. It was very easy to get to off of the 73. We had a balcony with a nice view of the back bay and the county fair off in the distance. We really liked the layout of the room and how comfortable the bed was. It had a murphy bed and a fold out couch and it was nice to have the doors close off the room with the king sized bed. You could get to the bathroom from either the bedroom or the living area, which was really nice. It also had a lot of closet space. We used the pool at night and loved the comfortable lounge chairs. The only negative is the price for

This trip to Newport Beach was to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We'd never been to Newport Beach before but had heard many good recommendations.  Our desire was to find a hotel close to the beaches, hopefully with a good view, a compfy bed and room, and a nice pool area.  First, the positives of this hotel.  It is in a great location.  I never checked to see the mileage from the hotel to the beaches near the Balboa Pier or the Newport Beach pier but it didn't take much time to drive.  It is within walking distance to Fashion Island, a mall complex that had enough to entertain us for an afternoon of window shopping.  It has great access to and from the freeways.  We drove from LAX at about 3pm and it took close to 50 minutes.  On our return drive at around 1pm on a Saturday we

Summary Heading: Really nice hotel, but far from everything
Summary: This Marriott was extremely nice.  Rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable and they had a full service bar and restaurant.  The hotel is located on a small bay which has a peaceful feel.  Each room has a balcony and the fitness center was bigger than most hotels.  It was $33 to park per night and about a $25-$30 cab ride to any restaurants or bars near the coast.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, great service, ok location
Summary: We recently stayed at the Newport Beach Marriott Bayview hotel.  The king suite is comfortable, the work-out room is good, staff are helpful and very friendly, and the breakfast bar is the best.  The only down-sides are the $21 self-parking fee and hotel location is 6-7 miles from the beach.

Perfect retreat for our last minute overnight visit to OC.  Easy access to Balboa Island and Newport attractions, restaurants, shopping.  Requested our one bedroom suite on ground level, by pool-very tropical-no need to pay extra for view room.  Enjoyed pool, firepit, hot tub by day and night and breakfast buffet. Ask for AAA or senior discount (ifyou are a senior-ouch)-worth it.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel & I will definitely comeback again.
Summary: The hotel is very nice & clean. Staff are very helpful & courteous.  I love the rooms because they're all suites. It's close to the shopping area & the beach. Starbucks in the lobby is a plus.  I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, but expensive and caters more to business travelers
Summary: Stayed here with my family of 4 - kids 10 and 12.  We also stayed at a Courtyard by Marriot in San Diego the same week (Liberty Station), so my review is in part a comparison with that hotel.  I'll be brief.  Nice:  The room worked well - a suite with a large pullout bed in the main room for the kids.   The hotel is very clean and in a good location for Newport.  It's nice to have the nature preserve next door.   The breakfast is good and the staff in the restaurant is very helpful. Pool is nice - the kids enjoyed it a lot. Beach towels available for free at the front desk.  Not as nice:  $21 a day for parking - which you can avoid by parking down the street for free. Hotel attempted to charge me for parking even though I didn't use it - they corrected when I brought to their

Our family stayed here for a bit of relaxation prior to our Disneyland stay and had a great time. Good location close to everything Newport Beach has to offer and was extremely easy to get to from the airport. Took us about 8-10 minutes is all. The room was comfortable and the pool area is great! Loved that is had large comfy lounges and was part outdoor and part covered!

Summary Heading: Great suite and stay at Marriott Bayview!
Summary: I decided to try this Marriott as I have stayed at many other places in the Irvine / Newport Beach area and the price was good for a weekend rate and a little bit more of a resort feel to relax over a weekend stay in the area.  Check in was easy and I was offered an upgraded room with a view of the back bay.  The room was very nice and spacious.  The bathroom was terrific and stocked with plenty of towels.  The fridge and mini bar area was also nice.  Spent most of the weekend relaxing in the pool area which was nice.  The pool was partial indoor / outdoor pool and was fine.  There were not a lot of lounge chairs that received sun exposure, so that would be my only complaint there.  Enjoyed lunch at the pool, Marriott Hamburger, which was good and had great poolside service.

Summary Heading: Worst ever experience at a Marriott
Summary: If the astonishingly poor customer service here would have been better the oldest and most worn bed (actually had troughs between worn springs) might not have bothered me so much.   The front desk staff were erroneously argumentative about our group reservation, and continued to debate the number of rooms in spite of presented empirical documentation; only to ask, after several tired folks started to fear having to find a room elsewhere, whether we wanted additional rooms.   Bar staff ignored us at the counter despite having only two patrons and made us wish we were at any other hotel.   I can only surmise that the hotel is being foreclosed as that could explain the poor FF&E as well as untrained or apathetic staff.    Marriott and ownership should be concerned.

I've been staying at the Marriott Bayview Suites in Newport Beach, CA for over three years, at all different times of the year, and always enjoyed my visit.  The other day, I went to book a reservation for a weekend stay, and found that all of the so called "discount" rates were $60 more than the standard weekend rate of $169.  Now, I know this is summer and the rates go up then, but charging $60 more for a "discount" rate is not only ridiculous, but also fraudulent.  A discount can't cost more than the standard rate.  This $60 extra charge was for the senior discount, AAA discount, and the military discount.  I called the hotel to ask if there was a problem with their website and nobody had a clue.  I was then connected with "reservations" and promptly disconnected.  I called
Manager Response: Xander 05,  I see you have re-booked an upcoming stay with us. I am sorry for the guest experience you had during your past stay at the Bayview Marriott. I will be here to greet you when you arrive to the hotel, so I can ensure that this stay is exceptional!  Have great travels and see you soon,  Hotel Operations Manager

Summary Heading: Is this the right place for you
Summary: Very nice hotel that lives up to Marriott standards. It is very close to John Wayne Airport at the edge of a business district and has views of Newport Bay and wildlife area. Rooms are mini sweets that are well kept. Thought it would be closer to the tourist district of Newport but its a bit of a drive down Jamboree. Its seems this is a great place for business travel or meetings but too far from the tourist areas for my needs this time. Serice very good.

We stayed in an upper floor 2 bedroom suite, very quiet and facing the bay - the price was great (except for the parking fee, but no biggie) and bed was extremely comfortable.  The staff was friendly and welcoming, giving us a good recommendation for a restaurant for dinner.  The buffet breakfast was varied and delicious (except for the pancakes, unfortunately, which were inedible, for some reason).  As we were there for only one night, not many more observations but a very good (but short) stay overall.

This is an all suite hotel with an excellent welcoming staff. It has a different feel than the more traditional Marriotts, not as busy and very quiet. Downsides are the self parking, at $21 per day, and no full time concierge. I made a restaurant reservation through"at your service", when I checked on it at the front desk, the reservation was never made. It was handled by the front desk attendant, and we were surprised with a free desert complements of Marriott. All in all a nice hotel, a little between a Courtyard and a traditional Marriott.

Summary Heading: A quiet hotel in peacefull surroundings
Summary: Easy access to freeways, shopping centers ( South Coast plaza, the District, Tustin), golf courses, beach Helpful and welcoming staff ( front desk, restaurant, room service,housekeeping) Great Eggs Benedict! Roomy suites with quality bedding, fridge, coffee machine, large bathrooms, microwave oven on each floor, self service washer and dryer, free computer and printer access ( with internet ) Pleasant walks along Back bay Too bad the in-room internet access and parking are not complimentary!

Summary Heading: Out of the way and right on the trail
Summary: This is an exceptional property, slightly out of the way, but in a wonderful setting on the Newport Bay estuary.  If you are a walker or a runner, bring your running gear and set off for a walk along hiking trail that follows the bay.  The hotel is very spacious with each room a semi-suite and most with great views.

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel for Business, Reasonable Price
Summary: I travel to this area a lot and decided to stay here for something different.  They way they describe the hotel online is not very accurate.  The first negative for me was the fact that you had to self park with no valet option.  As a female traveler arriving alone late at night, this is a big deal.  I arrived at 10:00 p.m. had to park a good distance and walk through a dimly lit parking facility to enter.  The hotel was not much better than a Courtyard. As an elite member of Marriott you expect certain things when you book a Marriott brand vs. a Courtyard.  There was not concierge lounge for elite members and they had a small snack store (like they do at Courtyards) where you could buy a very limited selection of items.  The hotel was clean and seemed newly renovated, so that

Summary Heading: Good, reasonably quiet hotel with some interesting nature walks nearby
Summary: **Beware: There are a couple of other Marriotts in Newport Beach with very similar names. With that warning, I'll say that this was a pleasant experience. The rooms themselves are "Marriott standard", with the usual provisions for a business traveler. I worried about the possibility of noise from the nearby superhighways (including Route 73 that runs almost right by), but the soundproofing was fine and my concerns unfounded. I had a little extra time to explore the area on foot, and discovered to my delight that Bayview Park, with interesting hiking trails along Upper Newport Bay, is only a block away. (Yeah, I guess I should have figured that something like that would be the case from the hotel's name; duh!)  It will at first appear that the area lacks nearby fast food or

Summary Heading: Good location and value for money
Summary: We stayed at this hotel the first two nights of a family vacation.  We had a room on the 6th floor overlooking the bay which was very clean and quiet.  We used the gym which was modern and clean, and we found the hotel to be well placed for trips into LA and the surrounding area.  It is not on the beach but is only 10 minutes drive from the front and all the restaurants.  It is near a running trail through the wetlands which my husband enjoyed. It was very good value for a room for 4 adults in the LA area and suited us fine.  The only downside was that we have 2 teenagers and so we had ordered a rollaway bed, but they didn't have one available when we checked in.

We recently stayed at this Marriot.  Our suite was comfortable, our request for a quiet room honored, staff was helpful, and breakfast better than expected.  We got the package that included breakfast and parking which made this an excellent value.

Large rooms, with seating area divided from the room, excellent service, good location close to Newport Beach, Fashion Island and OC airport. All for just 129 dollars a night. Price-quality ratio at its best.

Summary Heading: Newly Renovated- Very Welcoming- Perfect Location
Summary: Enjoyed everything about this property- Only real improvement would be in the restaurant arena, nothing memorable there. Other than that this is a newly renovated property. Easy to access. New gym with all the necessary equipment. Liked the suites with the separate sleeping and living room area. Definitely more of a business hotel though as it's not that close to beaches or to Disney/Anaheim area attractions. Would definitely recommend and will definitely return!

I was in the Newport area for business, and upon arriving, I discovered they upgraded me to a room with a balcony facing the Newport bay, which was a welcome surprise.  I had a room with separate King size sleeping area, and a living room area divided by double doors, all recently upgraded.  This is easily the finest mainline Marriott property I have stayed at in my stint as a Marriott Platinum member.  Breakfast buffet serves custom omlettes and has a view of the pool, deck, and bay area.  As the weather was just right I spent some time jogging in the trail by the bay literally across the street.  The hotel is also very close to the upscale Fashion Island mall, and a short drive to Newport Beach and Balboa Island.
Stayed for two nights, Classic Marriott – clean, modern, efficient at a good value. Heartily recommend.

Booked a 1 night stay for the wife and I to get out of the house and relax. Very nice hotel with the most friendly staff I have seen in a long time. Hotel has a small bar with very high prices. Only ate breakfast in the restaurant. Had the buffet, it was pretty good. Would come back again but I will bring my on liquor.

Summary Heading: Good location and boasting comfortable rooms
Summary: Have stayed several times at this hotel when visiting the area. Though it primarily caters for business travellers, it is a good alternative for leisure too. Very well located, close to most of Newport Beach and Santa Ana attractions as well as to shopping malls and Orange County Airport. Rooms are spacious offering separate seating area and nice views over ocean. Highly recommended!

Most of my stays at this hotel have been while traveling for business.  Overall, as a business traveler, I find it to be a no-nuisance type of hotel delivering on my needs. The staff is great (good likelihood to be called by your name), check-in is super efficient, newspaper in the morning and also pretty good food. I have ordered dinner on multiple occasions and their special of the day has been good.  Only thing I would recommend is to have fair expectation. It is not a 5* and don't expect 5* quality. You get what you choose and pay for.

Everything about this hotel is fine, accept one thing,,,,the people who work there. They are over the top, excellent. The service reminds me of my hotel stays in Thailand, and even I have trouble believing that; but it is true.

We stayed recently on a Saturday night as a part of a group attending a friend's birthday party nearby.  We were very impressed by the size of the rooms, particularly for the price.  I'm sure the weekday rates are higher, but we paid about $150/night on the weekend including breakfast for two and parking--a real bargain in that area!  Beds are super comfortable and bathrooms are large (with separate shower and bathtub) though with only one small sink.  Most of the people in our group travel frequently for business and they were all favorably impressed by this property.

Overall the hotel was overall good and in a safe location. What you expect from a typical Marriott.  Friendly staff and basic amenities. There were a couple negatives - Parking is $21 a day, shower was below average with minimal water pressure, and the pillows on the couch were not clean.

I stayed here for a wedding. The wedding was actually in Costa Mesa but they had blocked out rooms for all the wedding guests at this hotel. The rate was VERY affordable, especially for New Year's Eve weekend. The rooms were comfortable and spacious with a living room in addition to the bedroom. Both areas had TVs. The bathroom had a separate tub and a shower. The bay side had a nice view, though my room faced the parking lot. The beds were comfortable. Overall, a good deal for a weekend getaway.

Summary Heading: Good hotel at a good price
Summary: We came to the Marriott Bayview for a wedding and it was a good stay.   It was nice to have a suite with the living room area, bedroom and spacious bathroom. Our view was not of the water but of the parking garage across the street so not great but okay. The room was very clean and it was nice to have a small fridge, coffee maker and separate shower/bath. There was no fan in the bathroom so that was a tad annoying and no close mirror (shave mirror) so you have to lean over the sink if you're putting your contacts in or need to get up close.   The bathroom is also short on sink space/storage so I ended up putting the hair dryer on the carpet when I wasn't using it.   The room was very quiet (third floor) which was definitely appreciated.   The hotel wasn't really near anything so

All rooms are 480 sq ft suites which we found to be extremely comfortable and spacious for the two of us. Living room separated with double doors to bedroom, separate sink/vanity room and shower/toilet. Excellent view of the bay. Pet-friendly! GREAT if traveling with or without kids and/or pets because just a few steps away is the bayview walking/jogging/biking trail. Fantastic way to get a little exercise around beautiful scenery.  Staff was attentive, professional and courteous. Starbucks coffee is sold in hotel. Did not eat in restaurant or use the pool/jacuzzi. Enjoyed a cocktail (complementary) on the patio overlooking the bay.  Would highly recommend this hotel for the accommodations and price.

The room was incredible - french doors led to the bedroom.  The room had a balcony overlooking the bay.  I slept with the sliding glass door open, letting the fresh ocean breeze into the room. The room service was great.  I had steak and egg breakfast and the portions were astounding (see photo).

I arrived late at night for a short stay and I was greeted in the parking lot by Carol who adivsed me of the construction going on and where to park then I parked and went inside where she took good care of me and there was a foul up of the payment by my company and it was taken care of quickly.  Carol offered me some free goodies for being a member and then gave me a candy bar and allowed me to park the next day for free while I was already checked out.  Very positive experience.

Summary Heading: Nice view, excellent service, great night sleep
Summary: I enjoyed the stay at the Marriott Suites Bayview largerly. there are other Marriott's nearby including a Courtyard so when reading this take into account this is the one I am talking about. i dont have anything bad to say about any other cause I havent stayed there, but just wanted to clarify this first hand. Rooms live up to their suite name, are comfortable, ample and nice. had a nice view of the pool area. The staff was nice and friendly and breakfast at the hotel was very good, not large, but very good.

The staff at the Marriott Bayview is very caring. I left some importants items in my room and a hotel official took the time to walk  to my room, find the items and mail it back to me that day.  This is a great hotel and I highly recommend it.

We enjoyed staying the suite room at this Marriott. The French door separate the living and bed room.The pull out sofabed was pleasure giving the kids a good rest by their own. The room lay out floor plan as the Intercontinental in LA which made us pleased.Stuff is friendly too,we arrived late night.We called and requested for upper level and quiet room.They reserved us a suite at the 8th floor.The parking is too pricy, $21. There is no free continental breakfast is providing as the all the Marriott would serve their guest.No steam or sauna room at this hotel.Shallow and tiny bathtub at the room.We made this trip to visit Knott Berry Farm and Bower's museum.It is about 20-30 mins drive to both places.

We chose this Hotel as the location for our stay during our Wedding.  A beautiful hotel with fantastic customer service.  Our suite was more than expected, the staff was professional and responsive and the grounds provided an added bonus as a backdrop for some pre wedding pictures!  We had a large amount of guests staying at the same hotel and the event staff worked with us to make sure all accommodations and needs were met.  We had a memorable stay and would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: All suites hotel in Orange County
Summary: I stay very regularly at the Marriott Bayview in Newport Beach. I love the rooms, they are all suites with a great view over the laguna. The beds are confortable, it is conveniently located near the John Wayne Airport, Fashion Island shopping center and not too far from The District and South Coast Plaza shopping Area. Only draw back is the food at the restaurant. It is not of high quality, more of a Ihop quality.

Summary Heading: Stayed here 1 night - loved my stay and service
Summary: We stayed here for 1 nights with our marriott point and absolutely loved our stay:  check in: smooth, freindly and professional, all the information was provided, we got a warm and friendluy welcome and got information about the surroundings  Rooms: we had a very nice room with 3 parts, bedroom, living area and bathroom, which felt cosy,luxutious and comfortable. Everything was very clean.   Food: we got complimentary breakfast buffet, and had a good selection of foods. Fruits were nice and fresh, and eggs were as too be expected in a buffet. Service at the breakfast was fast and friendly. We also had drinks and some food in the bar. Drinks were good, food was average, but athe ambiance in the bar was nice for a hotel bar, and the service was friendly  Parking: 21 $ for

I enjoyed a two day business trip at this property and was really impressed with my beautiful suite, the cleanliness of the room and the property in general and the gracious staff. The breakfast buffet (though expensive) was great and they were easily able to accomodate my dietary restrictions. True, they do charge extensively for parking and breakfast, but for business travel, it is perfect!

We stayed at the Marriott Bayview this past weekend for a wedding.  It's a decent enough hotel, but would recommend it more for the business traveler than for the average vacationer.  It is very conveniently located with a short and cheap cab ride from the John Wayne airport which is a giant plus!    We had quite the time getting the hotel to recognize and honor the negotiated wedding rates...it took like 5 separate conversations to get it straightened out...which took until we checked out.  However, I have never been to a hotel for a wedding that has ever gotten this part of the process 100% right...even my own wedding.    The rooms are comfy and good for multiple people staying in one room.  Most rooms have a Murphy bed and/or a sofa bed and the master bedroom closes off with

Stay away. they charge heavily for parking/internet. even breakfast is not free. Initially they told parking is free. but they charged on checkout.  Accidentally I put some pen/ink mark[which can be easily removed] on a table. they charged huge charges [170$] to my credit card as damage, they told they have to replace it.  Strongly discouraging...

My wife and I picked the Marriott BayView for a quick midweek getaway and thoroughly enjoyed out trip.  There are two Marriotts in Newport Beach and you can't go wrong with either.  The larger Marriott at Fashion Island is more spa and family oriented.    We chose the BayView and for us it was the right choice.  This hotel is quiet and understated in it's approach.  The staff from top to bottom is uniformly gracious, friendly and accomodating.  The hotel is modern and immaculate.  The rooms are true suites.  All with huge marble bathrooms, separate bedrooms and full livingroom with bar.  Both rooms have either a large window or small balcony.  The bay view room views are worth the cost.  The hotel itself has a wonderful public area looking out over the bay, pool and garden.  The

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Nice View, Great Rooms!
Summary: I was highly impressed with this hotel.  We ended up scoring a great deal on priceline for about $60 a night.  It was a two bedroom suite with  a king bedroom and TV in the master suite, and access to the bathroom via a pocket door and the other room looked like a living room area during the day with a couch and a TV and desk and by night a fold out bed that sleeps two and a bed that folds out from the wall that would also sleep two.  The living room area has access to the bathroom as well and there is a sliding divider door between the sink area and the tub and shower and potty area.  YES THIS BATHROOM HAS BOTH A TUB AND SHOWER!!!!  There is also a sliding glass door out to the patio area where you can take in the beautiful fresh air and views of the bay.    The staff was

Summary Heading: All that you would expect from a Marriott, excepting a major failure from housekeeping
Summary: This is what I have come to expect from Marriott: a hotel that is modern, clean, and in impeccable condition. I am in a suite (Gold level M.R.) that is absolutely stunning.  I like the location, near Jamboree and 73. I can be on Balboa in about 15 minutes, at the mall in about 10, and I have easy access to other locations inland.  I was very impressed with the front desk staff and found them to be helpful, very friendly, and even recognize me by name several hours later as I walked by the desk. My stay is a little complicated, using a certificate from my M.R. account and another from my wife's account. They deftly set it up so that it was pretty seamless.  I was frustrated slightly, twice, when the room key failed to be recognized for entry into their parking lot. But I was

I travel down to Newport every summer to enjoy some nice waves, restaurants, milfage, and perfect weather.  As others have already mentioned, this hotel is right at the Bay and has nice views, especially if you get the right room.  I am familiar with Marriotts and this one lives up to the standards.  One thing to keep in mind is that all the rooms are suites.  No double queen beds if you are travelling with a buddy, like I was.  The sofa opens up as a sofabed, but..you know how those are.  Not much within walking distance, so for all visitors, you need a rental car if you want to go to the beach, restaurants, malls, etc.  There are several Marriotts in the area, so check them all out for the best rate per experience.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for business
Summary: Just spent 10 days here for business and have been to many hotels over the years in the area.  The layouts of the rooms are good, facilities are 1st class and the staff are very helpful and polite.  Without a doubt I will make this my #1 hotel when visiting travelling in the area for business. As others have said also, yes it's called the "Bayview" but look on a map before you go if you expect to see the sea. Then you will discover that it is nearly five miles from the beach as the seagulls fly. This is only 10 minutes in the car and not a problem to get too. Its location is far enough away from the flight path for John Wayne airport so you do not notice the plans which cannot be said for many business hotels in the area. Try it out and see what you think for yourself.

Stayed at the Newport Bayview a couple times and have enjoyed the time there.  Because of its location away from the main part of Newport Beach there is a peacefulness to the property.  I requested, and received, early check-in privileges.  This alone is what I considered to be a major selling feature of the hotel.  Some specifics:  -Location: hotel overlooks the Upper Newport Backbay.  This is a major SoCal wetland area with many bird species either passing through during migration or residing here.  I enjoy sitting out and watching the skimmers in the late afternoons.  Plus, within walking distance to the trails around the wetlands area.  Freeway convenient too.  -Rooms: they are suites with kings in the bedroom and a living room outside  Service: didn't utilize any room

I travel with the 'Marriott' chain frequently over the years and am well-acquainted with their brand, and high standard of hospitality.  I have come to favor this (particular) locale for its secluded hilltop setting and quieter ambiance, overall.  There is a larger more centrally situated Marriott over @ 'Fashion Island', but that property gets more families, more kids and therefore, more noise!!!  If you prefer a more refined, adult-setting, I highly recommend trying this Marriott next time you are visiting the area;  many times I have come here for a quick 'weekend escape'  - staycation!  And then at other times, strictly passing thru on business. The welcoming Lobby and picturesque Lounge area, is instantly soothing to the nerves of the 'weary Traveler' or for a cocktail

My family stayed over the weekend for fun.  The King Suite is very nice, clean and seems to be newly renovated. The living room is modern and has the pull-out bed for the kids. The flat-screen TVs are really nice.  The kids really loved the pool.  I personally really like it because the pool extend from inside (covered) to outside.  For someone like me who likes to sit under the shade and watch the kids playing in the pool, it is perfect.    The only complaint I have is when I checked in the hotel around 3:45PM, they told me my room is not ready yet.  Did not offer any apology, just a matter of fact.  When the check-in time is 3PM, the room should have been ready.  And $21 for self-parking is a little bit too high.

I stayed here for the weekend as a treat during a business trip. The room was very nice, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was excellent. When I called about an internet problem they sent someone to my room immediately to help. The chef at breakfast was excellent, making me a veggie omelet and Mickey Mouse pancake. :) The workout facility was newly remodeled and was state of the art. The pool and hottub area was very nice.   I thought that the hotel would be on the beach but its actually was on a bay that was a bit smelly which was dissappointing. It was about 3-4 miles to the actual beach. They had no shuttle service to the airport or beach.

We chose this resort because of it's location to shopping and dining.  It is situated on Newport Bay, three miles from Fashion Island.    The rooms are very well done with a king suite and separate living area with a small refrigerator and  coffee station.  Our view was of the bay and the pool.  Our only complaint about our room was that even though the Marriott is a smoke free facility the man below us smoked on his balcony constantly!  I don't know how this can be enforced but when you go to the beach in the summer you certainly want to enjoy the cool, clean ocean breezes coming in off the bay.  About the bay, there is a ten mile walking/riding/running/horse trail around it.  At one point west of the hotel there is a nature center that is very well done.  They were holding a

Summary Heading: Big rooms and short drive to beaches
Summary: We came here along with our children to visit the beaches.  We liked the seperate bedroom with its own flat screen tv.  The rooms are large and have a small refrigerator, two LCD tv, a seperate shower and tub and there was a microwave by the ice maker.  The lobby is big, lots of windows and there are lots of seats to sit and relax.  The grounds are kept beautifuly, they actually reminded us of the grounds at the Waikoloa Beach Marriott.  The staff was always very courteous and quick to assist us, with directions, local information or bringing extra towels to our room.  A couple of blocks away are many fast food restaurants such as Pizza Hut, Del Taco, Burger King, Starbucks, etc. I didn't see any other type of restaurants nearby, mostly businesses.   What we liked the most was

Summary Heading: All suite hotel with great breakfast, but only the king beds have a view
Summary: As a top tier Marriott customer I expected to have a great view of the back bay from my hotel room like the pictures in the ad but was very disappointed to learn that only the king size beds had the view and the double beds were all on the other side looking at nothing.    I have to say the long time chef in the restaurant is amazing and will custom make just about anything you want.  My sister loves his huevos ranchero and I could not get enough of his special french toast.  I highly recommend you at least eat breakfast there, although it does not come with the room like an Embassy Suites.

I just returned from a two night stay at Marriott Bayview.  My experience was extremely positive and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.  The one bedroom suite was large and comfortable ... I really liked the Bath & Body Works amenities.  One can find parking down the street for no cost, but I opted for the convenience of hotel paid parking, and also internet.  Only complaint: internet charge is for one day, Noon to Noon so if you purchase it in the evening, it expires at Noon the next day - hardly "one" day of internet.  Usually a purchase is good for a 24 hour period ... highly deceptive in my opinion.  Had one meal at Heron's restaurant (breakfast) which was fine ... nothing special but certainly fit the bill.  The pool was busy and although I didn't use it, I did feel

we stayed there over memorial day weekend . still only complaint is the parking fee . you can park down the street for free . the room lobby and ground are very clean . we check in early with no problem . having the fridge was a bonus and there's a microwave by the ice machine . I would definitely stay again . similar hotels closer to the beach are triple the price

Summary Heading: Better than I thought it would be
Summary: I stayed her over the past weekend with my wife and 11 month old daughter. i was pleasantly surprised upon my arrival to find the hotel in much better condition than I had read in some reviews. The lobby was nice and clean. Our room was very nice and clean as well. The only negative thing that I wanted to mention is the scenario that went down when I checked in. I asked the front desk at check-in if they had any rooms facing the bay. The gentleman said he did have one available but would have to charge me a $20 upgrade fee since the resort was booked. ? Not sure what that had to do with it. But I reluctantly accepted. After he swiped my card and handed me my key I asked about the crib we had requested when we booked online. He said it was already in our room as they had noted

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel and Staff-Horrible Starbucks Coffee
Summary: This is a lovely modern clean hotel with great facilities. Staff were very friendly, professional and accommodating. Although we heard several planes before 11 a.m. and after 7 a.m. it's in a safe business district very close to Fashion Island. The only complaint was the Starbucks coffee which was horrible and nothing like we've ever had at Starbucks. I had the first coffee replaced free of charge and it was still very poor.

First of all, my husband attended a conference at this hotel, I tagged along for the ride.  So it was kind of a business/pleasure mix. I don't like to say bad things before pointing out the good, and there were some things that were very good. My husband said the food provided by the hotel for the conference was excellent. The housekeeping staff was wonderful.  We have a small child with stuffed animals.  Every day they were all arranged nicely on the couch and the room was very clean. The hotel was very clean all around.  The lobby was very nice, the pool area was wonderful and well stocked with towels.  There are also several lounge chairs around the pool if you just wanted to read or relax. There was a cute gazebo and fire pit with lots of seating outside.  Since there were
Nothing extra special but certainly adequate.  Staff was professional and room was quite spacious.

I just wanted to say my fiance and i had a not so great experience with our first time staying here at the Marriott Bayview. I had the evening planned out but nothing seemed to turn out that way. We first did not recieve our bottle of champagne when we were told we would, when we called down for it they told us they were waiting for our call eventhough we were told it would be at our room at 5pm, they said they would send it up, an hour goes by and we still have not recieved our bottle so we had to call back down to remind them and that took another 20-30 mintutes. When we ordered our "complimentary breakfast" we were charged 35.00$ for it because we did not order downstairs but no where was it specified that we could not order room service, and we did not recieve our breakfast

I love this hotel. This is our weekend getaway hotel and we come here at least 5-6 times a year. I love it! My favorite part about the hotel itself is the balcony looking out at the bay. My 2 year old and I have spent many mornings and evenings hanging out watching the birds and people running the trail around the bay (also the horses!). We bring our bikes with us and it's right next to the trail so we bike on over to it and it's a really great ride. I wish this bike path was closer to home; I'd ride it every day.  The rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable and it's close to a lot of different restaurants and shopping areas.  The pool is also fun for the kids.. it's one of the only hotel pools we'll take our daughter in and she loves it.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for family with kids
Summary: We like the suite...this hotel is all suite Marriott. But no executive lounge though. Pool is not huge but it is good size. We went to beach in the morning and come back for the pool. This hotel is very close to bike/walk path. Hotel is clean and the room has two LCD tv. Kids like this and I like this because it has starbuck coffee in the morning. OVerall, it is good hotel if you look for beach fun at OC and have enough room for family of four.

Well, as I have said before I have been staying at Marriott properties all over the planet since the 1970's. The Bayview Marriott is right up there with some of the best in the US. Once you leave the states however, the properties are on a level way above anything we are used to here in the states.   This Hotel is just what the name says, "Newport Beach Bayview Marriott Hotel." It's a classy hotel, it's in Newport Beach (which is great) and it's a Marriott. Sometimes the properties I visit are run down or dirty or the staff is lame. However, I can't say that for the Bayview. The Hotel is clean, quite and VERY comfy. The views from two sides are outstanding. Even if you are on the Jamboree side and watch the traffic go by, it's mostly Porsche, Ferrari and an occasional Lambo so

We came for a weekend to check out the Newport Beach area. We got a great rate on a discount website. We loved our room and the people at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. They allowed us to store our golf clubs, beach chairs,  and bicycles, and didn't mind when we both managed to lose our room keys. The lobby is pretty and relaxing, and there is a nice area with a fire pit and comfy chairs outside. The suite feel of the room was a really nice surprise. The staff pointed us to a nearby golf course which we enjoyed. A great stay. The only change I would make would be to not charge so much ($18!) for parking. That seemed completely out of character with the rest of the hotel.
Nice clean place. Like many Marriott Hotels service and quality. Staff Friendly and courteous. I will stay again.

Summary Heading: Extra charges + Clean, comfortable room = OK stay
Summary: I stayed here for one night and found the hotel to be clean enough and the room was plenty big for me. The french doors leading into the bedroom were a nice touch I felt, especially if there were two of you and one wanted to watch TV in the living area while the other was trying to sleep.   You do have two nice flat panel tv's, one in the living area and one in the bedroom. A good desk to work from however I chose the couch and thought it was quite comfortable as well.   The bathroom was nice and clean, no issues there. The shower was a good size and plenty of water pressure, however I did have an issue with mine and temperature control. Every 30 seconds to a minute (once it started the first time), the pressure would drop and the water would become VERY HOT. Not the surprise

Summary Heading: A little disapointed for a Marriott property
Summary: Made reservations online with Expedia and specifically picked a rate that included breakfast each morning of our stay.  At check in, the front desk agent told us that only ONE breakfast was included because my boyfriend was a Platinum guest.  We ordered room service the next morning because the desk guy said the coupon would cover it.  We ordered the Steak and Eggs and it was probably one of the best at any hotel however this meal did not include coffee or a beverage?? so we had to order extra.  When I inquired at the desk the next morning the lady helping me said that b-fast was included, apologized and took the breakfast and coffee off our bill.  She then gave us coupons for breakfast for the next day but again, only one for the final day of our stay? She specifically told me

The loby was very nice, decorated with Christmas decorations for the season. We stayed New Years Eve into New Year's Day and it was pretty quiet. There's no  valet but you have to pay $18 a day for self park. The rooms arebig and the beds are comfortable however we did see a long strand of hair on one of the pillows and we hadn't even touched the bed yet. The pool/hot tub was nice. We spent some time in there and it was clean and quiet. There were two nice sized TV's in there but HD was not hooked up. We paid $75 w/ tax on Priceline for this hotel, I wouldn't pay anything more. It was just average. Based on what they say on their website describing the room, you'd be a little disappointed. My experience wasn't bad, it was just average. There isn't too many great things about

Summary Heading: Great views! Love the Bay walking path!
Summary: We stay here every Christmas, since other family lives up the road. It's a family tradition to start our days with Starbucks from the hotel and a walk along the bay path to the Muth Center (which is nice enough to leave their beautiful restrooms accessible even when they are closed - see coffee above!).  The view (from Bayview rooms) is wonderful - a touch of nature in an urban setting.  Rooms are spacious since it's a suite hotel. We buy cereal & milk for breakfast & enjoy the in-room coffee or Starbucks downstairs.  Have invited local family in for wine & cheese and the sunset view.  Beds are very comfy.  As others mention, parking is extra and so is internet access.  You can print your boarding pass for free in the lobby.  Staff has always been helpful and friendly.

Stayed on end of business trip only because it was close to Orange County airport. Left hotel at ~ 6:00, no breakfast available, very few people up. Very clean room, but $12.95/day for internet is crazy. Should have stayed at  Embassy Suites up the road, at least they have happy hour.

Summary Heading: Your price will be higher than what you're quoted
Summary: What were you quoted as a room rate?  On top of it you must add $18 per night for parking and $13 per day for internet access.  When will Marriot join the 21st Century...the "cheap" hotels offer free internet access.  This Marriot is NOT close to Newport Beach, nor any other restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, etc.  This is NOT a hotel within walking distance of anything but a backwater bay that is more like a swamp.  However, the rooms are very comfy and spacious.  Not sure I'd recommend this place due to undisclosed additional charges.

I recently stayed at the Marriott Bay view for a business trip. It was a nice stay for business trip but would not recommend this hotel for leisure. The main selling point of the hotel is the all-suites setup.   Pros: -All rooms are suites with a separate living room, bedroom, and bathroom -Mini-fridge in room -Separate bathtub/shower -Hotel was clean  Cons: -Hotel is located in a business park and is a 10 minute drive from the beach. -The nearby bay is uninviting, not a selling point. -On-site parking is expensive -Room service selection was very limited. -Internet is expensive

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good location for the airport (SNA)
Summary: Two of us had a morning flight out of John Wayne Airport so we spent the evening before at the Marriott Bayview and we were both very happy with it.  Check-in was easy and rapid.  The staff was very nice and we were given a corner room with a view of the Back Bay.  Fairly spacious; certainly comfortable for two people with a very large bath, lots of nice marble and both a tub and a free-standing shower.  You do have a mini-fridge in the room but you have to go down the hall to use a single micro-wave oven on the floor.  That's something that you don't often see in 'better hotels'.  Since we had already turned in our rental car we decided to eat dinner in the hotel.  I've stayed here several times before and eaten breakfast and lunch here but never dinner.  It was a good choice.

Summary Heading: Never been treated so rudely and unfairly in my life!
Summary: This was hands-down the WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE of my entire life.   I have never been treated so rudely, unfairly, and disrespectfully.   We came here last weekend with six girls for a bachelorette party and stayed in one of the one bedroom suites. We came back to our hotel room around 2:30AM on a Friday night and had music playing on the Ipod speakers they provide for you in the room.   We hear a knock on the door and open it to find one of their employees, Theo, asking to speak to a lady who had made our reservation but was not even staying there. After explaining that for a few minutes, he proceeds to take my friend who had her credit card on the room (and the Bachelorette) outside to talk to her privately - refusing to let us hear what they were saying. She comes back in and

After reading some of the reviews I was not sure if I had made the right decision on picking this hotel. Once there my opinion completely changed. The staff were very accomodating, the rooms were good and the whole family had a great time. We had a bay view room on both the 6th and the 8th floor in that we stayed there twice in a two week period. The hotel ticked all the boxes and I have recommended it to others for the price and what you get I think you would be hard pressed to find anything better.

Summary Heading: Look elsewhere if you have children
Summary: The price and the location were what we paid for and the suite we stayed in was sufficiently nice, but the stay had a decided downturn regarding the pool area. My wife went down to the pool with two of our children one evening and returned disgusted 30 minutes later. There was a group of five or so drunken young adults in the pool and hot tub area being obnoxious, smoking in the pool itself and making the environment unfriendly toward families. What made matters worse was a hotel employee giving this group a thumbs up when they asked whether their behavior was a problem. I suppose if you don't mind a lack of oversight and swimming in an ashtray, this place is for you.

This hotel is everything a hotel can be to ruin a perfect vacation.  We had bayview rooms but were not warned that there would be a barge working on the bay for two days, 24/7.  Our room faced the bay, alright, and had the most exquisite sound effect of dredging, ALL NIGHT LONG.  Then, when we asked to change rooms, which was appreantly a great inconvenience to the desk person, he told us we could have another room.  When I went to the other room, I ended up terrorizing some poor women that was already in the room.  When I put the card in the door she really got scared, thinking she was going to be accosted by some stranger trying to bust into her room.  I felt truely aweful, but the front desk person didn't seem to be sensitive to it at all.  Then, the meal at the hotel was

In typical Marriott fashion, the Marriott Bayview had pretty much everything I needed to make my business trip to Southern California to meet with a client comfortable and restful.    The early morning view of the bay was a nice touch and the staff were friendly.

Summary Heading: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in!
Summary: My husband, my 1 year old son and myself booked an early Father's Day trip to Newport Beach.  I won the hotel on priceline.com for $70 a night (you can actually win it for $60-$65).  This hotel is BEAUTIFUL and all the rooms are suites so their is a bedroom, living room, balcony and LARGE bathroom!  The bed is SO comfortable that when I got home yesterday I went online to find out how much all the bedroom products were.  They were pretty expensive but WELL worth the money.  We had a king size bed that had a pillow top mattress, down padding, down duvet and the pillows were so soft and plenty (I LOVE pillows).  Our 1 year old loved to crawl around on the soft bed and crawl around the whole room!  It was cute!!  The bathroom is large with a separate bath/shower and that is

This is a simply wonderful hotel.  It has been recently remodeled and the rooms are spacious and beautiful.  In fact, the entire hotel is beautiful.  Somebody really put a great deal of effort into the interior decoration.  Each room is a mini-suite with bedroom and living area, separated by french doors (with frosted glass panes for privacy).  The beds are very comfortable...even the sofa bed is comfy like a real bed.  The large bathroom has a separate tub and shower, lovely lighting fixtures, marble floors, and a good supply of fluffy towels and washcloths.  Both the bedroom and living area have a large flatscreen television.  The lighting throughout is soft.  This is a hotel that realizes that no woman wants to put on makeup under harsh fluorescent lighting.  We were told

We were in Orange County to visit family and I lucked out getting this property on Priceline.com. We were thrilled every second of the time we were there. While not on the beach our room overlooked the Back Bay, and the walking/running/biking/horse trail that goes around the bay and to the beach is a wonderful OC oasis. The Back Bay is a natural preserve and it was a delight to have such  close proximity to it. The lobby was beautiful, the pool lovely with a fire pit at night to sit around with a drink and look out over the bay. Most important were the rooms. They are all are suites, and I loved having a separate living area, french doors to the Master bedroom, balcony, beautiful bath etc. I can't say enough good things about this property which amazes me cause I grew up in

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel -- but a bit out on it's own
Summary: Overall a great experience staying here. Pros: -decor is classy, very nice -rooms have a seperate bedroom, with a queen sofabed in the living room -mini-fridge in room is great -pool is great -staff are great, very helpful  Cons: -location -- it's in a business park area quite a ways from the beach. it borders on to the newport bay, but it's a muddy and unattractive sight from the hotel --parking and internet are pricey! found free parking on the nearby street

Stayed 3 nights at the Marriott in March after winning a bid on Priceline ($65 per night + tax).  All of the rooms are suites with a separate room with a king bed, flat screen TV, and then a main sitting room with a pull out bed and flat screen TV.  The bathroom had a bathtub and separate shower.  The room was very clean, I think it must have been recently renovated.  The king bed was extremely comfortable.    The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Parking at the hotel was $18 per night, although we just parked at the bottom of the hill (about a 2 minute walk away) for free.  Internet + local calls + free long distance was $12.95 per night.    All in all, a very nice hotel, very quiet, and very business oriented.

We stayed here this past weekend for Valentine's Day.  It's towards the east end of Newport Beach where it is practically Irvine but the location was convenient for my wife being close to shopping in Costa Mesa and Irvine as well as Newport Beach.    The room is a small suite, and we had a king bed which basically took up the entire bedroom area, although there was a nice LCD tv in the corner.  The main room had a larger tv, a sofa bed, desk, a couple chairs, a bar, and a fridge underneath.  We liked the layout and the style was contemporary.
