It had a very large bathroom with a separate bathtub and shower.  My wife liked it and said it felt like a small apartment.    We had a patio that overlooked the parking lot and a few buildings.  We were on the 6th floor and the hotel was

I was shocked to see several so-so reviews of this lovely hotel. We stayed here for two nights in early January 2009 and we LOVED it! What a beautiful setting and what lovely rooms! We loved the separate sitting area and separate bedroom, the spacious bathroom, the heavenly smelling toiletries, the plush mattress and luxurious bed linens, the beautiful grounds and pool area, the absolute quiet at night - I could go on and on! The staff was very helpful and attentive and there were many extra touches throughout the room, hotel and grounds that we appreciated. I had no complaints about this hotel at all and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. And I would recommend it to anyone without hesitation. We have stayed at other Marriotts and have never been disappointed - this one is

This was supposed to be a great ending to our honeymoon. My husband is in the Military and Marriott galdly appreciates the Military with a discount, but with that discount you should also expect discounted services! I wanted to use my laptop to find a great restaurant to eat dinner and was told that I would have to pay 12.95 for the evening.... to look up a restaurant, so I told the hotel desk to send me up a list of all the Itilian Restaurants in Newport Beach. Oh and dont for get that you will have to pay 18.00 for parking... I paid 17.00 at Disneyland and it was for Valet... to park my own car, I had to pay 18.00. I dont believe anyone else parks here, and I feel it is another way for them to nickel and dime people. We also had the great upgrade to have the bay view.... um it

I stayed at the Marriott Bayview for 2 nights, while in California on a business trip.  I agree with the last reviewer that this hotel is nothing special.  The pool looked nice, but small; the bar also decent, but small, water by the elevators was nice.  I was a bit dismayed by the $12.95/day for internet (not even wireless), when many lesser quality hotels offer wireless for free nowadays.  Also, parking was another 15 bucks or so a day, and the lot was extremely small with very narrow spaces.  The suite setup w/ balcony was nice, the separate shower/bathtub another nice touch, but the setup of the sink outside the bathroom did make for awkward utilization.  The business park location is a bit out of the way from the ocean, though there are a number of restaurants and shopping

I stayed at the Marriott Bayview for one night with my 2 teenage boys.  The hotel is nice but does have some problems.  The location is quite a distance from the ocean and in a business park setting.  I asked for a bay view room and was told I would have to pay an extra $30 for the room.  (I booked the room using Marriott points).  The room is nice with a separate living room and sleeping room however the bathroom set up is very inconvenient.  The sink is in the master bedroom and is separated from the other bathroom area by a sliding door.  The door is very heavy and doesn't slide well so it is impossible use on a regular basis.  If you have someone sleeping in the livingroom it is an awkward set-up.  The bathroom was worn and not very clean.  The breakfast was decent with a

When we travel. Marriott is our first choice.  We go to Newport Beach every year and usually stay at the Balboa Bay Resort or Marriott Hotel and Spa.  This year we decided to stay at the Bayview Hotel.  It looked great knowing the room is advertised as a suite and such.  We had a promotional code for the 'fashion island shopping spree.'  When we got to the hotel they said they could only honor the promotion for one out of the 4 nights we were staying there.  I had personally confirmed through Marriott that the promotion was good throughout the stay and the confirmation was noted as so.  We went ahead (unhappy) and booked the room.  When we got to our (upgraded bayview) room we were very disappoited with not only the view but also with how dated the room was.  We immediately got

I stayed at this hotel way, way back in 1991 for over a year. I still think about it at least once a week. Get room 917, bring a montain bike and enjoy! Kitayama is a great place to eat as well and is around the corner (sorry room service!)

My husband and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel, because of the location to family we were visiting. The hotel was clean and the check in process was quick. The rooms are suites with a sitting area and a small refrigerator, which was nice.  We stayed on a higher floor and out view of the pool and expressway was noisy at time. We ate breakfast a the hotel twice, and the fresh fruit plate was excellent. Thre is  also a Starbucks coffee at the bar, which was a great bonus for us. Be prepared to pay for parking $15 night.

I loved staying there.  The hotel staff was very accomodating.  Also, the room was wonderful.  It was nice to have  a separate area since my husband and I were traveling with my daughter.  The living area actually had 2 beds, the pullout sofa bed and a pullout bed from the wall.  My daughter loved that because it was more comfortable for her to sleep on.  The king size bed in the bedroom was very comfortable.  It was very easy for me to fall asleep because the comfort.  The only thing that I would recommend to the hotel is to change the sheer curtains on the french doors to thicker ones.  I absolutely loved staying at the Bayview Marriot and would stay here again.

We had a very nice one-night stay here. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The rooms very clean and nicely decorated (I especially loved the separate sleeping area with french doors that closed) so you could hang out on a couch and chair while in the room.  Featherbed and the down comforter and pillows made the bed very cozy.  (My husband felt the bed was too soft, but it was perfect for me).  Others in our family had a murphy bed in their rooms that were comfortable. Pool area very nice and water was perfect temperature. Nice patio chairs throughout the courtyard provided nice quiet areas to hang out while waiting for family. Breakfast and lunch restaurant food was very good, although lunch service at the pool eating area seemed slow, even for a group of 12 people.

The Newport Beach Marriott is a shining example of what a hotel/resort and it's staff should be. Upon entering the lobby we were immediately greeted and waited mere seconds for a resevations agent to help us. We were given a beautiful room, with an outstanding rate. Our room, as well as every other part of the hotel was immacuate. A beautiful ocean and bay view, large HD television  and balcony were only a few of the ammenities in our room. The entire propety was beautiful and impressive and every member of the staff we we encountered were friendly and professional. Even the barstools in the romantically-lit lounge were unbelievably comfortable. There were candles and fire-pits on the outside patios making for an extremely romantic evening. Our experience has moved Marriott and

We were very frustrated that they wouldn't accept our rewards buy one get one free coupon even though we called 3 times to Marriott to set it up and then called the hotel direct to make sure they honored it.  They ended up giving us the $170 a night room which saved us a bit but not what I was planning.  We ended up viewing a time share nearby to earn points so I could stay on budget.  It's not the greatest of locations as you have to drive everywhere.  The layout of the room was exceptional but I think that is more of a reflection on Marriott.   The stay was good but I certainly wouldn't pay full price.  Parking was $14 a day and internet was $10.  No breakfast offered but the restaurant was very good, if expensive if you want to splurge: $9 for a glass of wine for example.

We enjoyed our visit. Really comfortable beds!  Some of the rooms do have a view of the bay but this hotel is about 5 miles from the beach.  The suite part has a nice sofa, chair and desk.  A dorm size refrig and a coffee maker.  No utensils, cups or plates.  Maybe you have to ask for those and we didn't.   Good shower too.  Each room has a tiny balcony but no chair to sit on which would have made it nicer to enjoy the view and the lovely weather.  Easy to get most anywhere from this spot.

Summary Heading: Fun Night Away with the Kids!
Summary: We spent a night here for a little getaway with the kids back in May.  The hotel is great! Rooms are nice, pool is nice and staff is friendly.   These suites are great if you have kids because you can get some privacy from them at night.  The pool area has great atmosphere.  Part of the pool is indoors and then it flows outdoors.  Perfect if you don't want a lot of sun!! We ordered room service the night before and it arrived promptly at our requested time.  The kids loved their Mickey Mouse pancakes with M&M's!!   My only complaint is that it took a while to replenish the towels at the pool.  We were promised new towels in 10 minutes and it took close to an hour and multiple people to complain. We really enjoyed the bike/walking trail which is right across the street. We will

This hotel is in an excellent location.  Close to Balboa Island, Disneyland, Fashion Island Mall, and beaches.  The grounds, lobby and pool area are pristine and beautiful.  Our children loved this hotel. The front desk is friendly, responsive and a model for others.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a great restaurant on site. The rooms are suite style with a double door separating the main bedroom from the sitting room.  The bathroom is large with a separate tub and shower.  The only downside to the rooms is that the upholstery is dated and worn.  Also, my husband was irritated that there is a $10 internet fee that runs from 12-12.  So if you use your computer the day you arrive and the next morning, you will pay $20.  He thinks this is antiquated as he travels alot for

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a business trip
Summary: Just spent four nights in this hotel -- it's very nice.    Each "room" contains a sitting area, bedroom and bathroom.  The sitting room has  two couches, a sink, refrigerator, coffee maker, television, desk and, at least in my room, a balcony.   The bedroom is separated from the sitting room by french doors and the bathroom by sliding doors.  It's small but the bed is very comfortable, with nice bedding.  The bathroom has both a bathtub and shower stall, can be entered from the bedroom or sitting room and has an additional door to block off the sink from the rest of the bathroom.   There are a few problems with the hotel --  I hate paying $10 a day for any internet service, especially wired.   There is no wireless, and every time I restarted my computer I had to log in again.  A

Stayed in smallish one-bedroom/one bath/two tv suite with wet bar/minifridge.    Easy access from freeway and main streets.  Recommend you request high floor room assignment looking towards the lagoon.  Public areas freshly done; guestroom decor was tired but bedding was updated and of high quality.  Part of pool is covered, incuding the whirlpool -- very good if you're looking for shade.  You'll need lots of quarters for the coin-operated washer/dryer.  During our stay the bartender made terrific margaritas and the bar's snack menu was good.  We didn't use the restaurant.  Front desk staff friendly and competent.  Cons -- daily charge for parking in open-air lots; charge for internet access from the lobby.  Pros -- Close to Fashion Island for shopping and restaurants and

I just stayed at this hotel for one night. There were 4 of us (2 adults, 2 seniors), and we all enjoyed our stay.  The suite is on the small side, but it is very nice to have a separate sitting area. The sofa folds out into a full-size (double) bed and the hotel will bring up a rollaway bed, too. There was a wet bar and a small fridge in the corner.  The bedroom is separated by french doors. The bathroom also has several pocket doors to divide up the sink/vanity area, the tub and shower and the bathroom from the living room or bedroom.  Bathroom is spacious and clean. It could use a little updating, but everything worked fine. There were plenty of towels and toiletries.  Parking is extra, which is standard at any hotel in the area. You will need a car. There is nothing within

A really nice hotel with great help from the desk, I did not pay for this trip however and would not pay the amount which was paid(around $300). There was nothing wrong with this hotel at all. e.g. great location, clean, friendly - just too expensive!

Stayed April 5,2007 using reward points.  Wanted to be close to the airport for the last night of a Southern CA visit.  Check-in was OK.  Room was a nice layout, but needed some serious housekeeping; dirty shower but the bed was fine.  Not much of a view, but didn't expect one when using reward points.  Requested a roll-away when I booked the room and at check-in was told it was in the room.  Took two phone calls and over 2 hours to finally get the roll-away.  Went to the restaurant to pick up several desserts to take back to the room and was "greeted" by a host with an unpleasant attitude.  Received rather small portions for the price.  The menu listed key lime pie with raspberry sauce, but the pie came with no sauce.  When I pointed this out, the host sneeringly replied that

We sought a Valentine's weekend getaway at an Orange County hotel with a view of water and decided to stay at this hotel due to the reviews.  We were not disappointed here!  Although the balcony did not have any patio furniture, we lounged on the comfortable chair and couch in the living room with the balcony window wide open.  We just loved it!  And we watched the sea birds and tides.  Just what we hoped for. Loved the suite setup of the room and the very comfy king bed.  The staff was pleasant and we had no negative experiences to speak of.  The Fashion Island Shopping center is a short distance away (by car) and the drive to the coast was very pleasant.  We are definitely thinking of returning to stay here again.

This hotel is in a great location right off of the highway.  It's intermingled in with a business district which is in a nice little area.  Most, if not all of the rooms have a balcony and have a separate sitting area away from the bedroom.  The bedroom had its own tv and the living room had one as well.  The room was very large and provided ample room.  The lobby area was nice and has a nice little patio area to sit and look at the Newport Bay.  This was certainly a nice place to stay and wouldn't hesitate to try it again.  However, I would probably check out the Marriott Spa hotel up the road just to compare the two.  Overall... a great hotel that I would recommend!

My husband and I stayed here for a weekend to attend a wedding nearby.  Not being a huge fan of large chain hotels I wasn't expecting to feel as comfortable as I did.  The decor is predictable yet clean and well-maintained. The rooms are all mini-suites which is very nice.  The living and sleeping areas are totally separated by french doors with TVs in both.  The bathroom has a full bath and separate shower.  There is a little balcony, too - we had a nice view of the bay (we requested it on check-in).  The room was nice and bright, too.  One nice touch is the fruit infused tankard of ice-water for guests by the elevators.  I took advantage of that every time I was nearby.  That being said, this is NOT a hotel for the tourist without a car.  It is about a 10-15 minute drive into

Loved the place!  Staff was wonderful.  Intimate, very stylish lobby.  Understand rooms are to be redone next year.  Good central location.  Wonderful courtyard for lunch and great view for reading my book!!  Enjoy!!

This is a hotel suited to conferences rather than individual stays. Newport beach is at least 5 miles away - dont be misled by the Fashion island location - this is a shopping centre island way inland and you have to have binoculars to enjoy the harbour view. Facilities within the hotel were all OK as was the service and staff, but the pool is quite small for the size of the hotel. Also room rates are high and yet 'self-service' parking is still extra. Would not choose to stay there again.

Summary Heading: Not a great place to stay
Summary: Location is not good.  Our "city view" room had a view of the roof of the parking garage across the street.  I tried to get another room, but the one they showed me overlooked a busy street.  The balcony was tiny and there were no chairs out there.  The pool is VERY small.  There were rows and rows of lounge chairs lined up about  six deep at one end of the pool.  There is a ping pong table by the pool that our daughters enjoyed.  The staff was friendly, but the property seems very old and is desperately in need of a facelift.  I think charging guests $12 per day for parking is outrageous.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating to our children (suckers at the front desk for kids).  The breakfast buffet was great with most everything made to order and fabulous fruit!.  The chef made my son a special Mickey Mouse pancake complete with M&Ms.   The pool was nice and suite rooms spacious.  We were at the Marriott for a wedding on site and the staff was very accomodating for that event too.

Summary Heading: Hotel that tries hard,good sevice,rooms could use some updating
Summary: This hotel's staff is one of the hardest trying, fastest group of about any other property I have been to.The rooms could use some updating the furniture upolstery is worn and a the cottge cheese ceilings should go and the bathrooms are clean but also need updating.The bed is very comfortable,the TVs are ok the one in the parlor part sits on a low table and they are on the cheap side.  The pool itself was not very clean the water was very cloudy (too much use ,not enough chemicals) and was not pretty to look at.The pool deck itself had plenty of towels,lounge chairs,tables and even a ping pong table.There is poolside food and beverage service or walk inside and order on your own.  Parking $12,internet $9.95  I would stay here again there are some improvments that can be made but
Marriott beats Hilton any day!  Very courteous and helpful staff.  Attention to detail --water provided, generous Bath and Body Works amenities, and most importantly....a beautiful view!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but too much wrong information given out!!!
Summary: This is an actual suite hotel unlike some that say they are but are actually only one room. This has a separate living/sitting room with its on T.V. and a bedroom with ITS own T.V.  The bed was a large queensize bed with nicely appointed ruffled linen and the living room had BOTH a pullout sleeper couch AND a Murphy bed (though you would have to move the furniture quite a bit to utilize both.) In the l.r. is a separate sink over a mini fridge that has room for a coffeemaker with instant coffee makings on top.  It also contains a large writing desk and for extra charge you get internet access. The bathroom is quite large, the room for the double sinks are can be closed off from the tub and shower (yes they are separate) and toilet room.  Towels are plentiful and soft and

Summary Heading: Loved Marriott Suites and the staff
Summary: This hotel is Excellent for its price range.  It's not a luxury hotel, but you're not paying for luxury either.  The rooms are very well appointed (i.e., tub w/separate shower stall, plentiful towels, nice linens and furniture) and there is plenty of privacy within the rooms themselves - lots of doors to isolate different areas.  The staff was incredibly helpful.  Buffet breakfast is very good and reasonably priced.  While parking at the hotel is an extra fee, free parking is available on the street.  The price for a two room suite through a discount broker is moderate enough that parking isn't burdensome at $10/day.  You always have a parking space, too!  Location is very convenient.  You're on the Pacific Coast Highway within a few blocks and Fashion Island is very close, too.
